descriptions.overview: Say goodbye to the fumes, the mess, and the hassle, and start enjoying the cordless freedom you deserve. Every 40V Max tool works off the same rechargeable, interchangeable battery platform, so you can pop in a new one and keep going as long as it takes. Plus, with Kobalt’s state-of-the-art lithium-ion technology, you get more torque and more speed with fewer recharges.
list: Kobalt 40-volt cordless mower provides the power you need for up to 40 minutes runtime on a fully charged 5.0 Ah battery (battery and charger included)
3-in-1 feature offers mulching, rear bagging, or side discharge capabilities
Kobalt 40v Mower with Brushless motor offers plenty of power and runtime for yards up to 1/2 acre
20-in steel deck for added durability; Easy start at the push of a button
7-position single lever height adjuster for the perfect cut on all grass types
Compatible with Kobalt 40-Volt MAX family of products
Stores vertically for more space in your garage

reviews.title: "I'm Impressed!"
reviews.text:
I expected this thing would be a flop; to die a quarter or even half-way in, but surprisingly I was able to mow my entire backyard (approximately 6400 square feet) and I still had half of the battery left. What's even better is that it'll last me for the side-yard and front yard as well. This is accurate with the manufacturer estimate I read somewhere which states it'll do about a quarter of an acre on a single charge. Now, keep in mind that I walk quickly. As I would get into thicker areas of grass, the mower would speed up to compensate. So the battery life will be dependent on how think your grass is, how fast you walk, and the depth you set it to.

The box it comes in has holes on the sides so it's easy to carry. The mower only required minimal assembly (attaching the handles), so it was easy to get right to it. I did not need a single tool to assemble this or get it going. Now, the battery came 25% charged and took over an hour to reach a full charge, so I would estimate an hour and a half from fully dead to 100% ready, though the site states 2.5. 

The handle is ergonomic and designed at just the right angle to take the stress off your wrists. It feels like you're riding a riding a speed bike. I have a bad knee and a messed up back, so having something which is about twice as light AND has an integrated lift handle at its fulcrum point is a deal-breaker for me. It's about as easy to push as a gas mower with a self-propel option (except you're not having to waste more gas on the extra belt/gear/motor/chain to drive it). 

There is a cover to prevent water from getting into the electrical compartments, and the bottom is sealed well, in case you decide to get crazy with it and use it in wet environments. There is a key which must be inserted to run the unit (just in case someone wanted to steal it). You can take this key, drill a hole in the top, and put it on your key-chain/carabiner or elsewhere for an added security measure. Of course, someone might be able to buy one of these and still use it. 

I'm not sure why there is a kill switch running along the wire towards the power button, but it's there in case you need it. It does take a few seconds to stop the unit however. If you let the throttle rod go, it'll die within a few seconds just like a gas lawn mower. However, with a gas mower you can catch the rod right before it dies and that will give it enough fuel to start up again, but with this mower you can't do that. -It's either all or nothing. However, you get the benefit of simply pushing a button instead of having to yank a cord each time. Speaking of cords, there are none! I used to use a corded mower and while it was still lightweight, it was a NIGHTMARE constantly having to lasso the cord from place to place like a cowboy. 

I like to leave my grass cut high, so I set the unit at its highest setting (7), and it matched the height perfectly at which I would normally keep it. This also means that the mower didn't have to work as hard since it didn't have to go as deep. It also reduces the amount of clippings, though normally I would just mulch it anyways. In this case, the blade comes very sharp from the factory and mulches up your clippings very efficiently. I like the side discharge option, which you can switch out back and forth to a bag if you will by removing the rear insert. The clipping bag is designed well. Whereas a typical bag would be long and short, this one is short, tall, and reinforced, having extra metal bars around the opening and even a handle stitched into the back to aid with disposal. -Did I mention this mower has a single lever height adjustment system? -That's right; all wheels adjust with a single lever. Perhaps for professionals there is some use to an independent system, but for the average Joe this is top-notch. 

Last of all, I love the fact that this mower is emissions free, reducing exposure to more harmful chemicals. I know after a long mowing session I can feel nauseated by all the toxins, especially if I have to quickly jog through and get the lawn done before the sun goes down. I'm sure there are a few things I'm forgetting (like how quiet it is), but with a 5 year warranty on the unit and 3 years on the battery, this is GREAT! You'll be able to mow late at night or early in the morning, not having to bother your neighbors or family while they're sleeping.
reviews.author: Charger68

reviews.title: "3 in 1 Lawn Mower"
reviews.text:
This Kobalt mower has the 3 in 1 options that everyone loves and uses. It can mulch, use a side discharge or use a bag, which is included. Also included in the purchase is a 3 year warrantied 40 V battery, and a 6 Ah battery charger. The mower, itself, has a 5 year warranty. It took my husband 15 minutes to assemble without any tools required. The deck measures 20 inches and the mower weighs 56 pounds. It can store vertically in the garage and offers a brushless motor.

The wheels are plastic and the rear wheels measure 10 inches. The very nice feature of this mower is the ability to change the cutting height to so many different levels ranging from 1 3/8 inches to 3 3/4 inches. The battery and charger provided works also with the other Kobalt 40 V max system tools. The battery has a nice fuel gauge which shows charging level. The mower blade is 20 inches and is made of steel.

The mower has an electric push button start, which operates very quickly and quietly. It started the very first time without any effort. The handle also can adjust to three different angle operating positions. My husband is 6' 4" so he has the handle at the highest level.

This is not a self-propelled mower, but it operates very easily and cuts very efficiently.
reviews.author: preppygirl56

reviews.title: "So Far So Good"
reviews.text: Bought it today 6/11/2017 . Easy setup about 15 mins. Battery has 1 Bar Charged it for 30 mins added 1 more bar(2 bars total). Started mowing same day I bought it with height of 4. Dry Grass sunny and 91F outside. Lasted about 30 mins. Cuts great (tip: sharpen the blade 1st its probably dub for packaging reasons).  Replaced my used 2 year old Neutron CE6 with Overheats every 5 mins. So Far so Good!
reviews.author: Johnny

reviews.title: "For the smaller yard"
reviews.text:
This is for the 40 volt cordless Kobalt lawnmower. Really did have some reservations on just what a cordless lawnmower would do, but thought it worth a try. Glad I did. For sure this mower would not be good for a large yard as I am sure it was never intended for that anyway. But for a smaller yard, it is great. 

In the pictures you will see the before cutting and after cutting. The 2 inch wide tires are prefect to keep from getting deep tire marks in the grass as you can see and we had rain the day before so the ground is soft. You can also see the clippings in the bag showing a nice clean cut. My only true concern is the plastic knobs that hold the top half of the handle in place. They are plastic and as such, if over tighten may well strip out. 

When you first get this, the battery has to be charged and this will take a couple of hours to do. 

Time will tell how good the battery life is. For mowing our yard which takes about 20 minutes, found the battery still had ¾ charge left. Grass type mowed is Fescue. 

Here is what I like;
Bag fits between the handle making for easy removal and installing.
Catcher is easy to empty.
Wide tires.
Easy one hand height adjustment. There are several heights to pick from.
Handle height adjustment is easy to do as is folding the handle down for storage.
Battery is easy to take out and reinstall. This goes for the safety switch too. There is also a place to store the switch.
Charger can be hung. 

Con: 
Plastic knobs for top half of handle. 
Grass catcher size. Could be a bit larger.
reviews.author: Spoon

reviews.title: "Glad I switch to electric/battery mower!"
reviews.text: I was looking for a low cost gas powered mower when I ran across these electric / battery push mower. I was skeptical at first but read reviews from others and decided to give it a try. Glad I did! No more gas, oil, oil filters, etc and its MUCH quieter.  I was impressed by the power! and I was impressed by how the motor revs up/down based on the how thick the grass is.  Would I buy one of these again? Absolutely!  Would I upgrade to the 80v? I don't know, probably not.  I debated between the two and the 80v was $100 more but came with two batteries.  Here's my assessment of the 40 vs 80v: if you need 80v system you probably need a riding lawn more. And here's why: I can almost mow my entire yard with 1 battery charge and I almost need a riding lawn mower (see pics).  The 40v lasts about as long I can last in the hot Florida Summer sun. I just cut 75% the lawn with one charge and when the battery died, I was glad! Needed break. And if I don't need the break, I just grab the battery trimmer and use it while the mower battery is charging.  I could spend $80 for a 2nd battery but decided to cool off and do other tasks while the battery is charging. The one downside is that the battery get real hot and it will not charge when hot. So I have to put it in the freezer for 10-15 minutes to cool off before charging. One important point: I do not use the self-propelled feature as it drains the battery faster and I need the exercise! :)  If you need a self-propelled system, you might consider the 80v system due to the increased demand on the battery.  I've attached pics to show you how much I just cut with one battery charge.
reviews.author: Rich

reviews.title: "Love this mower."
reviews.text: I don't like having to deal with gas and oil for regular mowers.   Kobalt has hit a home run with this jewel.   I have a small yard and the grass was knee deep.   I made one slow pass over half the yard before the battery was done. . . I was okay with that, I got over 30 minutes out of the battery, and planned to finish the next day.   The battery charges in 2 hours, the mower pushed on through with way overgrown weeds, and will probably last longer when it's not overgrown.  My pictures show the proof.  First mowing this year, I am new here and didn't have a mower.  Very happy with this for a small yard.
reviews.author: MarkB

reviews.title: "Nice Mower, but the Battery isn't what they say"
reviews.text: The mower battery says that it is good for up to a half acre. My yard is only a quarter acre and it takes 3 battery charges to cut my back yard and one charge for the front. What the specifications also don't tell you about recharging the battery, is that it takes about 30-45 minutes for the battery to cool before you can start to recharge it. So I wouldn't recommend this mower and battery except for the smallest of yards. The pictures are as far as I cut the back yard on just one charge, then after the second charge, it still took one more after that to finish.
reviews.author: Brittany

reviews.title: "Decent mower but can't replace 5.0 amp battery"
reviews.text: The mower itself is great.  However, Lowe's only sells the 2.5 amp replacement battery ($99).  It only lasts about 20 minutes and bogs down in higher grass.  The 5.0 amp battery that comes with the mower works great and when mower hits higher grass, the rpms of the mower increase.  This does not happen with the 2.5 amp battery.  The 5 amp battery has an average runtime but you can't buy a replacement that is 5.0 amps.  While it is nice for a very small lawn, your average lawn will likely need a 2nd battery.  Poor execution from those designing and deciding replacement parts to carry.  I wouldn't buy again unless it came with two 5.0 amp batteries.
reviews.author: Paul

reviews.title: "Very poor Mower"
reviews.text: I bought this mower and was very excited to have an electric mower. Now after a few months of owning this mower I am VERY DISSATISFIED. This mower comes with 1 battery which should be able to get through to simply mow your front and back lawn. IT DOES NOT. I have THREE BATTERIES and cannot even finish my backyard let alone the front yard without having to recharge the batteries and come back 5 hours later or even the next day. This mower lacks power too. If your grass is more than 4" tall..this mower struggles greatly. I wish I would have bought a gas mower. Picture included...
reviews.author: Adam

reviews.title: "Not a Long-Term Lawnmower Even for a Small Yard"
reviews.text: I have had my Kobalt mower for two years.  The mower is just ok but will not cut well in damp grass and certainly not tall grass.  This is the third battery I have had to replace with each one losing power within the mowing season.  I despise having only a half cut lawn from loss of battery power.  I called Kobalt support a number of times at 855-854-3057.  They have graciously sent me a new battery each time of which I cannot complain.  However I cannot recommend the mower product long-term with the hassle of ongoing battery replacements.  After my three year warranty expires, I will probably go back to a gas mower since the battery alone is the cost of such a lawnmower.
reviews.author: Marty

reviews.title: "works great on pavement"
reviews.text: I really want to like this mower. Purchased in March and it worked great. Went all in and bought the trimmer too. Then rainy season started in central florida. I have a 1/4 acre and 1300sq ft house, there isnt a lot of lawn to mow, but this thing can not get it done. If your grass is never wet or dewy then this is a mower for you. If your grass isnt thick or a little tall then this mower is for you. If you live in a dry climate then this mower is for you. Otherwise you will be frustrated. I cant even finish my front yard without burning through 2 batteries and about 20 restarts due to clogging. Incredibly disappointed.
reviews.author: craig

reviews.title: "Looks good, cuts smoothly and quietly"
reviews.text: This mower or shall I call it electric pair of scissors  is absolutely amazing IF you are cutting a yard the size of a welcome mat or maybe a living room rug (if you have an extra battery). It cuts smooth,quietly and consistently, however you will need about sixteen 40 volt batteries to cut a SMALL yard. I don't know about you but I'm not a fan of having to mow for 15 minutes, take a shower while the batteries charge and repeating that process 3 times just to finish the front yard. This stupid mower probably raised my water bill and laundry detergent cost for the month. Thanks a lot kobalt. That's why craftsman replaced you on the shelves.
reviews.author: Paulcenso

reviews.title: "Good choice for us.  Glad I got it."
reviews.text: Was needing to replace my gas-powered push mower this year.  It was wearing out.  My wife needed to be able to mow some too, when I was away at work, but she has shoulder problems and would struggle to pull-start a traditional gas-powered mower.  We have a smallish area that needs mowing with a push mower; We use a riding mower on our larger area.I looked at many gas-powered mowers because they certainly were nice, and I wondered if my wife could somehow pull-start them. I knew I couldn't/wouldn't afford an electric start mower.  Then I happened across these battery powered mowers.  I had not considered them because I thought they weren't any good.  The battery powered tools I'd had in the past were greatly inferior, and I didn't need an inferior mower that lacked power, didn't cut well, didn't last, and whose battery dies.  Little did I know.I read the specs and reviews.  These battery-powered mowers seemed like just what I needed for a small area - push start-ability, light and easy to maneuver, good cutting, sufficient battery, with the added bonus of no gas or oil.  And the reviews were mostly favorable.  So after thinking about it objectively, I did a little more research and decided on this model to meet my needs...a good mower for small areas that my wife could use, and at the right price.I charged it overnight and assembled it without difficulty.  My wife and I tried it out and we liked it.  It's easy to use, it cuts good, and the battery easily lasts for our purpose.  I cut for about 10-15 minutes, then I let it sit for 45 minutes while I prepared the next area, and then I cut that for another 15 minutes.  The battery still had two lights indicating 45% charge left.  It cut good too, better than I expected, and as good as I needed.  It might not have cut as good as a high dollar, high powered gas mower, but the grass I was cutting wasn't perfect either.  And just like you typically need to go over the same spot sometimes anyway even with gas mowers, I did re-trace my cutting occasionally mainly because the grass/weeds were bad.  But I wasn't displeased at all.  I was pleased it did the job I needed, and it did it very well, I thought.  And the battery held-up too.  I also liked the automatic increase in power feature when it was needed, and the easy height adjustment for my wife.  Now, if my wife wants to mow when I'm away, she can mow without any trouble at all.  No fuss, no muss.  Good decision, good product (for us).  I recommend.  I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 because I don't know how durable the machine will be over the long term.
reviews.author: JPinAndersonSC

reviews.title: "No replacemebatteries available in store or online"
reviews.text: This mower could be great, but there are no adequate batteries available, whatsoever, on line or in stores. The 40V Max 5 AH battery that comes with the mower holds enough charge to mow my modest front yard. It is necessary, then, to stop and charge the battery, before moving on to the back yard. I expected this, so went to Lowe's today to buy a second battery, so I could simply change a fresh battery with the spent one. NO 5 AH BATTERIES!! A battery with half the AH (amp hours), 2.5, certainly will not do. Next, I spent an hour looking online. The 5 AH is not available.
reviews.author: Joanne

reviews.title: "Great Electric Mower!"
reviews.text: I was surprised at the power and cutting capability of the mower, being electric and all. I had no problems with it and it is super easy to assemble right out of the box. Now I do not have a huge grass area to cut so that is why I decided to make the switch from gas to electric. If you are thinking of making the switch I would say go ahead and do it, you will not regret it. I can get 2-3 mows of my lawn on one battery charge, which will run for ~40 minutes on a full charge.
reviews.author: Javier

reviews.title: "Quiet!"
reviews.text:
Okay I must say I never thought this would work... I have never used an electric mower let alone a cordless! Much to my surprise I can do the whole yard with two batteries. It is great I hope the batteries stay strong! 

It's very odd and great to be so quie! Really takes some getting used to that mowing isn't loud. 

Very comfortable to push. Light but doesn't feel cheap, I like that 

All in all don't think you can mow huge yard or anything... but very perfect for smaller city lots. I included a picture of what one batterie will do. 

I like how the batteries also fit the other tools that match. I have the blower, trimmer and bush trimmer all holding up good
reviews.author: nailgunner007

reviews.title: "Get a Gas Mower Instead"
reviews.text: When I bought the mower, it worked great. However, I have had the mower for less than six months, and the battery has already deteriorated to the point that it can't even mow all of my tiny front yard without being recharged. If we have to miss a week of mowing due to rain, forget it. We would like to just buy a second battery and cycle through charging them, but the 40v 5.0 Ah battery is not sold by itself. Caring for my lawn now takes up several days because it takes so long for the battery to cool down and then recharge. We are deeply regretting getting a battery powered mower instead of gas.
reviews.author: Jillian

reviews.title: "Replacement Parts Are Impossible to Get"
reviews.text: I bought this mower trying to get away from the chemical exposure to gas. I lost the safety key. Totally my fault, I'm not blaming Lowe's for that. I went to the store to buy a replacement key. They don't carry them. I consulted the owner's manual. It says to call for replacement parts (can't just reorder online) between the hours of 8am to 8pm Monday-Friday. They don't actually open until 9am. I had to call back. I was given a reference number and told to call back in 2 days. Called back 2 days later and was told a rep would call me back in 3 to 5 business days. It is a tiny safety key! I am now 3 phone calls and one trip to the store in and NO KEY! Customer service is TERRIBLE!
reviews.author: Trish

reviews.title: "First electric mower and I'm happy with it."
reviews.text: Only used gas tools in the past. Just had a house built and wanted to try something new as many of my neighbors have battery powered equipment. Mower works just fine. Just don't use the lowest deck height on thick wet grass, which is a challenge for basic gas mowers. I can mow my front and back yard on 1 battery.  Would suggest get equipment that all uses the same battery so if you do run low on juice you can borrow from another. I'm a battery guy now.
reviews.author: GeorgiaBoy

reviews.title: "Works well if you have less than 1/4 acre."
reviews.text: When i first got this its actually cut the whole .25 acre over time it was getting less and less. now it can only do the front yard on the right side (half of left) as pictured which is bigger than the left side. I wish i could find a 40v 5.0AH battery in store but they all 2.5 and for $99 pricey.
reviews.author: raygar

reviews.title: "Battery does not last"
reviews.text: The battery does not last long enough to mow a 1/4 acre as advertised. I have a 1/4 acre lot, so after subtracting the space for my house and driveway this mower should be perfect. It took 2 charges just to mow my backyard. And it had only been a week since it was mowed previously and it was not overgrown. I waited another week and tried the mower again. It still took 2 charges for the backyard and 2 for the front. I decided to return the mower. The woman at Lowe's told me the battery is only designed to last up to 30 minutes and I needed to run with it if I expected to mow 1/4 acre with it. She also said mowing in the heat will cause the battery to overheat and die quicker.
reviews.author: Jess

reviews.title: "Batteries do not hold their charges"
reviews.text: I have had to replace my original battery and purchase a second battery, which cost me $100.  Even with both replacement batteries fully charged, I can only cut two thirds of my lawn (I live on a 60' x 100' plot, with about 60% grass coverage).  I only mow on fully dry lawns every five days during the warm months, and I keep my mower on the #3 setting.  Regardless, these crappy batteries still do not hold a charge.  The 40 volt batteries do not produce much power, and often miss cutting thicker blades - that I can live with, but when a battery fully charged dies after 15 minutes, that I have a problem with.
reviews.author: LFW

reviews.title: "Best Lawn Mower EVER!!"
reviews.text: I love this lawn mower! It was very easy to assemble and worked great after the first try! I'm not a fan of using gas-powered anything and this is a wonderful alternative. I considered going for the self propelled but my yard is small and doesn't take much. I had no problem pushing it, after figuring out what height to have the wheels at, and it stopped a couple times because the grass was slightly wet but a quick bag dump solved the problem. If you decide that you want self propelled, Lowes offers a 30 day return on it and you can easily take it back and get the other!Also, it's really pretty :D
reviews.author: Lauren

reviews.title: "Great mower."
reviews.text: This mower has been fantastic for us. I'm very surprised to see negative reviews! Have had zero problems with batteries. Admittedly not for a huge lawn, but we can run ours for 45 minutes or so on one battery and then switch to another if needed, which is almost never.
reviews.author: Todd

reviews.title: "Best Mower Ever!!!"
reviews.text: I love to mow.  Been mowing for 50 years.  I wanted to write this review to give it 5 stars, and also say this is a great mower for your average yard.  It's so nice, makes me want to mow 3 times a week, and I just might!!!   Easy to charge, very quiet, last for the entire front and both side yards, with plenty to spare.  I really really like this mower!!  I can't wait to try the accessories, think I'll try the leaf blower, then the weed cutter.  I have owned 3 Kobalt mowers, this one knocks it out of the ball park.  I know you will love it too, so pick up those rocks, and sticks, and enjoy the afternoon of quiet mowing!!  I use 5" on mine.  Put together with 2 nuts and bolts, how awesome!!  Great warranty.  Recommend highly, JF
reviews.author: JF

reviews.title: "Great mower, great battery life"
reviews.text: I was a bit hesitant to go with a battery-powered lawn mower based on some of the reviews, but decided to give it a shot. I've now mowed my lawn about 8 times with it, and have been pleasantly surprised. For reference, my lot is about .20 acres...my front and back yard combined take me about 16 minutes to cut (I timed it). The mower does a great job cutting. The blades kick into a higher gear when needed (taller or wet grass), and slow back down as needed. It's incredibly quiet, just a pleasant "whirrr" sound is all you hear. The battery life lasts longer than I expected. I'm able to easily cut my lawn twice on a single charge. Can almost get a third cut on a single charge, but comes up just a bit short. I believe this matches up pretty well with the advertised rate of 40 min per charge. Love that the mower folds and stands up on its end, makes storing it against a wall a lot easier so it takes up less space. I also have a Kobalt battery powered leaf blower which accepts the same battery, which is great in that I have two batteries that are interchangeable. I think my only complaint would be that it's not recommended that you spray it off with a hose...would love to be able to hose this down afterwards to keep it clean, but it's recommended you just wipe with a rag. But overall, extremely happy with this mower, and happy to never have to run to the gas station again before cutting my grass!
reviews.author: Marcus

reviews.title: "VERY Happy with my purhase!"
reviews.text: I had been contemplating the purchase of one of these for 2 years. I finally had to purchase because tugging on the cord of my gas mower was killing my sciatica. Long story short, this little mower does a great job on our city sized 8500 square foot lot. This mows very even, cuts great and does the entire job on a single charge. I would not wait until my grass was a foot tall before using, but my once a week ritual, this little gem gets 5 stars. No gas fumes, oil mess, carb adjustment or air cleaners to deal with, I love this mower!
reviews.author: DallasIrisGrower

reviews.title: "I Like it but...."
reviews.text: Ok this would be a great mower it it stayed on high power all the time.  Here's the problem it has a battery management system the only spins up to full power under a heavy load. You would think that would be great saving battery and all but if you're just mowing light grass sometimes it doesn't get all the grass at the slow speed. most of the time I have to go back over all my grass twice. If it's a heavier grass and it goes to full speed it works great. If I could manually lock it into high throttle it would be a 5 star mower.
reviews.author: Dave

reviews.title: "Great For Personal Use"
reviews.text: I got this mower for my lawn mowing business but the battery basically lasted for one medium sized lawn with medium thickness of grass. I ended up buying some 2.5 amp batteries and I promise you, the 5 amp batery is a better buy. I know it costs slightly more than two 2.5 amps but my 5 amp battery outlasts my three 2.5 amp batteries easily. I ended up getting the 80v mower to replace it for my lawn mowing and now I just use it for personal use and it works great! I will never buy a gas mower again.
reviews.author: AusticleLawnMowing

reviews.title: "Kicks grass"
reviews.text: I found out I needed a new mower when the grass was high.  By the time I could get to a store the grass was over 8".  I was worried that 40v may not be enough (I don't know much about it) but, when I fired up the mower it did great.  I started to put it on 4 and then make another pass on 2 but decided to just try it on 2.  It choked a couple of times but my old mower with a cord would have done the same.  It would have been a waste of money to get higher volts as this does very well.  I will only give 4 stars simply because I have not determined things like battery life though it easily finished my 1500sq' lawn.
reviews.author: Pat

reviews.title: "Battery does not last"
reviews.text: The battery does not last long enough to mow a 1/4 acre as advertised. I have a 1/4 acre lot, so after subtracting the space for my house and driveway this mower should be perfect. It took 2 charges just to mow my backyard. And it had only been a week since it was mowed previously and it was not overgrown. I waited another week and tried the mower again. It still took 2 charges for the backyard and 2 for the front. I decided to return the mower. The woman at Lowe's told me the battery is only designed to last up to 30 minutes and I needed to run with it if I expected to mow 1/4 acre with it. She also said mowing in the heat will cause the battery to overheat and die quicker.
reviews.author: Jess

reviews.title: "Batteries do not hold their charges"
reviews.text: I have had to replace my original battery and purchase a second battery, which cost me $100.  Even with both replacement batteries fully charged, I can only cut two thirds of my lawn (I live on a 60' x 100' plot, with about 60% grass coverage).  I only mow on fully dry lawns every five days during the warm months, and I keep my mower on the #3 setting.  Regardless, these crappy batteries still do not hold a charge.  The 40 volt batteries do not produce much power, and often miss cutting thicker blades - that I can live with, but when a battery fully charged dies after 15 minutes, that I have a problem with.
reviews.author: LFW

reviews.title: "Best Lawn Mower EVER!!"
reviews.text: I love this lawn mower! It was very easy to assemble and worked great after the first try! I'm not a fan of using gas-powered anything and this is a wonderful alternative. I considered going for the self propelled but my yard is small and doesn't take much. I had no problem pushing it, after figuring out what height to have the wheels at, and it stopped a couple times because the grass was slightly wet but a quick bag dump solved the problem. If you decide that you want self propelled, Lowes offers a 30 day return on it and you can easily take it back and get the other!Also, it's really pretty :D
reviews.author: Lauren

reviews.title: "Great mower."
reviews.text: This mower has been fantastic for us. I'm very surprised to see negative reviews! Have had zero problems with batteries. Admittedly not for a huge lawn, but we can run ours for 45 minutes or so on one battery and then switch to another if needed, which is almost never.
reviews.author: Todd

reviews.title: "Best Mower Ever!!!"
reviews.text: I love to mow.  Been mowing for 50 years.  I wanted to write this review to give it 5 stars, and also say this is a great mower for your average yard.  It's so nice, makes me want to mow 3 times a week, and I just might!!!   Easy to charge, very quiet, last for the entire front and both side yards, with plenty to spare.  I really really like this mower!!  I can't wait to try the accessories, think I'll try the leaf blower, then the weed cutter.  I have owned 3 Kobalt mowers, this one knocks it out of the ball park.  I know you will love it too, so pick up those rocks, and sticks, and enjoy the afternoon of quiet mowing!!  I use 5" on mine.  Put together with 2 nuts and bolts, how awesome!!  Great warranty.  Recommend highly, JF
reviews.author: JF

reviews.title: "Great mower, great battery life"
reviews.text: I was a bit hesitant to go with a battery-powered lawn mower based on some of the reviews, but decided to give it a shot. I've now mowed my lawn about 8 times with it, and have been pleasantly surprised. For reference, my lot is about .20 acres...my front and back yard combined take me about 16 minutes to cut (I timed it). The mower does a great job cutting. The blades kick into a higher gear when needed (taller or wet grass), and slow back down as needed. It's incredibly quiet, just a pleasant "whirrr" sound is all you hear. The battery life lasts longer than I expected. I'm able to easily cut my lawn twice on a single charge. Can almost get a third cut on a single charge, but comes up just a bit short. I believe this matches up pretty well with the advertised rate of 40 min per charge. Love that the mower folds and stands up on its end, makes storing it against a wall a lot easier so it takes up less space. I also have a Kobalt battery powered leaf blower which accepts the same battery, which is great in that I have two batteries that are interchangeable. I think my only complaint would be that it's not recommended that you spray it off with a hose...would love to be able to hose this down afterwards to keep it clean, but it's recommended you just wipe with a rag. But overall, extremely happy with this mower, and happy to never have to run to the gas station again before cutting my grass!
reviews.author: Marcus

reviews.title: "VERY Happy with my purhase!"
reviews.text: I had been contemplating the purchase of one of these for 2 years. I finally had to purchase because tugging on the cord of my gas mower was killing my sciatica. Long story short, this little mower does a great job on our city sized 8500 square foot lot. This mows very even, cuts great and does the entire job on a single charge. I would not wait until my grass was a foot tall before using, but my once a week ritual, this little gem gets 5 stars. No gas fumes, oil mess, carb adjustment or air cleaners to deal with, I love this mower!
reviews.author: DallasIrisGrower

reviews.title: "I Like it but...."
reviews.text: Ok this would be a great mower it it stayed on high power all the time.  Here's the problem it has a battery management system the only spins up to full power under a heavy load. You would think that would be great saving battery and all but if you're just mowing light grass sometimes it doesn't get all the grass at the slow speed. most of the time I have to go back over all my grass twice. If it's a heavier grass and it goes to full speed it works great. If I could manually lock it into high throttle it would be a 5 star mower.
reviews.author: Dave

reviews.title: "Great For Personal Use"
reviews.text: I got this mower for my lawn mowing business but the battery basically lasted for one medium sized lawn with medium thickness of grass. I ended up buying some 2.5 amp batteries and I promise you, the 5 amp batery is a better buy. I know it costs slightly more than two 2.5 amps but my 5 amp battery outlasts my three 2.5 amp batteries easily. I ended up getting the 80v mower to replace it for my lawn mowing and now I just use it for personal use and it works great! I will never buy a gas mower again.
reviews.author: AusticleLawnMowing

reviews.title: "Kicks grass"
reviews.text: I found out I needed a new mower when the grass was high.  By the time I could get to a store the grass was over 8".  I was worried that 40v may not be enough (I don't know much about it) but, when I fired up the mower it did great.  I started to put it on 4 and then make another pass on 2 but decided to just try it on 2.  It choked a couple of times but my old mower with a cord would have done the same.  It would have been a waste of money to get higher volts as this does very well.  I will only give 4 stars simply because I have not determined things like battery life though it easily finished my 1500sq' lawn.
reviews.author: Pat

reviews.title: "Outstanding!"
reviews.text: After being gouged by landscapers for years to do my standard city lot I realized that I could buy a whole set of Kobalt products for an amount equal to only 2 months payments to the landscapers (they would show up on March 31 and I would get billed for "March services").  I bought this mower along with the 40v blower and string trimmer during Lowe's recent sale.  I have used the mower for the first time and it was outstanding.  It cut very well.  It also has a convenient handle for lifting which one of it's more expensive competitors does not have.  As noted, I have used it only once, so I can't comment on longevity, but it seems to be a very good value.
reviews.author: JH

reviews.title: "Seriously love this mower"
reviews.text: I bought my 2nd mower recently and love it as much as the first. I left the other one with a tenant at a house I rent out and she loves the mower too. Unlike gas mowers, it starts right away, is very quiet, and there's no gas fumes/exhaust clogging your lungs and the air around. Battery power is excellent.. the 5 AH battery that comes with the new mower is awesome.. enough for my huge yard and then some. (I empty the bag 5 times on my yard and still power left over). 3 years on, I still think 'this thing is so cool!' every time I use it
reviews.author: 801LVR

reviews.title: "Awesome for Small Yards"
reviews.text: I loved using this mower! I currently have an older, pull start, self-propelled lawn mower (which I despise) and switching to this mower was wonderful. I am middle aged and out of shape but I didn't struggle at all with this mower - even on embankments. It literally takes 10 minutes (tops) to get the handle assembled and, besides charging the battery, that is all you need to do to run this. Sadly, I have to return it because my 1+ acre yard is just too big for this model. I had to recharge the battery twice and I still wasn't even half finished with my yard. If/when the cost of the 80v come down, I'm sure a lot of people will buy these mowers.
reviews.author: kel9396

reviews.title: "LOVE IT!!!! BEST MOWER EVER!!!!"
reviews.text: I love this mower! I also have the weed trimmer that is powered with the same battery. Very easy to adjust the height of the deck, no spilling anymore gas, don't have to take gas with me anywhere or worry about filling up, very low maintenance, the batteries last a long time... what's there not to like? My first chainsaw will defiantly be the Kobalt 40 volt chainsaw! I wish everyone had one of these!!!
reviews.author: Cowboyclayt

reviews.title: "Great product!"
reviews.text: I had been looking at a battery powered cordless mower for some time. This mower is so much better than my combustion engine mower. I love that when I am finished cutting my grass that I do not smell of gasoline (from mower exhaust and filling). It is also nice that the mower self-adjusts the speed of the blade to both cut cleanly and maximize battery life. The mower is lighter and easier to maneuver. My yard is pretty small so the battery life is no problem. Although I think this mower would do most normal sized yards and if you have a larger yard than just buy an extra battery. You will not be disappointed buying this mower.
reviews.author: Ihateyardwork

reviews.title: "20" Electric Hand Mower"
reviews.text: I got the battery out and charged it to full. I put the battery in and followed the way to start it, and it started right away. I had wait for it to stop raining before I could use it. It is very easy to use and moves very easy. It cuts very nice and even, and just went along. I let go of the starter handle and it just shut down very quietly. This will be very handy for me to get into small areas in my yard. It is a great mower.
reviews.author: Jackie

reviews.title: "Best lawn mower ever!"
reviews.text: Easy to put together, easy to start, and has an even cut no matter which height setting is used.  Will pay for itself in no time and my lawn looks better already!  No messing with gas fill-ups nor pull-cord starts.  And it's quiet!  Great buy!
reviews.author: Beth

reviews.title: "Surprisingly good"
reviews.text: My brother bought an electric mower a few years ago. It has performed admirably, so i thought i would give it a try. This mower is surprisingly good. It would bog down on really thick grass just like a gas mower would. But it would start a lot easier than a gas one, of course. Overall, i'm very pleased with its performance. I bought the Kobalt weed wacker too, so i have 2 40v batteries. Highly recommend that you habe a least 1 additional battery because they take a while to charge. It folds up for storage nicely too.
reviews.author: Kurtman

reviews.title: "Pure Power!"
reviews.text: I was looking for a mower that my mother in law could use with little maintenance and upkeep. After exploring a few options I decided to give this mower a try, mainly because of the great warranty. Once I got these mower out of the box it started to impress instantly! Assembly took less than 5 minutes and after a quick charge, we were ready to start cutting.  No fuel, no oil, no pull... pure simplicity! I got more than I bargained for with this mower, it is full of great features like the single height adjustment lever, vertical storage, and minimal noise! This mower is terrific and is the perfect addition to any yard. Highly recommend the Kobalt line ofMowers
reviews.author: David

reviews.title: "bad batteries"
reviews.text: I purchased this mower along with a 2nd battery less than a month ago.  The first usage was great.  I figured I'd need a 2nd battery to mow the full yard and I did but there was charge to spare on the 2nd battery when I was done.  A couple weeks later I went to use the mower a 2nd time and no such luck.  One of the batteries wouldn't charge at all and the mower would just beep if that battery was inserted.  The other one appeared to have charged but ran out of juice within a matter of minutes.
reviews.author: scottw22

reviews.title: "Outstanding!"
reviews.text: After being gouged by landscapers for years to do my standard city lot I realized that I could buy a whole set of Kobalt products for an amount equal to only 2 months payments to the landscapers (they would show up on March 31 and I would get billed for "March services"). It also has a convenient handle for lifting which one of it's more expensive competitors does not have.  As noted, I have used it only once, so I can't comment on longevity, but it seems to be a very good value.

Battery power is excellent.. the 5 AH battery that comes with the new mower is awesome.. enough for my huge yard and then some. After exploring a few options I decided to give this mower a try, mainly because of the great warranty. Once I got these mower out of the box it started to impress instantly! reviews.title: "bad batteries"
reviews.text: I purchased this mower along with a 2nd battery less than a month ago.  The first usage was great.  I figured I'd need a 2nd battery to mow the full yard and I did but there was charge to spare on the 2nd battery when I was done.  A couple weeks later I went to use the mower a 2nd time and no such luck.  One of the batteries wouldn't charge at all and the mower would just beep if that battery was inserted.  The other one appeared to have charged but ran out of juice within a matter of minutes.
reviews.author: scottw22

reviews.title: "Bad Batteries"
reviews.text: So, this product was good for about 1 year. Then the batteries start not working. If you try to take your batteries back, Lowes wont take them, they make you send them into a third party. So…i sent them three batteries, they sent back one, and after a month it does not work either.There is really no good reason to buy this, you cant save money cause a new battery for this is almost $100.So dont waist your time, just get gas powered and be done with the coming headache. -Julian
reviews.author: Julian

reviews.title: "Battery sucks  and not for taller grass"
reviews.text: I bought this from Lowes thinking that would be a nice lawnmower. Disappointment is the only thing that this has given to me.My 0.15 acre of lawn I had to charge for 4 times. The battery does not last even 20 minutes. This is the real disappointment. Kobalt claims it to last for 60 minutes and it does not last even 20 min on a full charge.Grass more than 3 inch - it will stop and not move, Later on, you need to move it to the area where the grass is smaller and then try to start it.
reviews.author: Pranav

reviews.title: "Horrible equipment; even worse C/S"
reviews.text: First time using my brand new Kobalt mower and even with my battery fully charged it only lasted 20min. Hardly enough time to mow just the front of my lawn. Went out there FOUR TIMES to get mow just my front yard and not have it look unfinished/uneven. Not only was this frustrating, but embarrassing. I called Customer Service and I waited over 28min before I finally got a person to pick up my call and assist me. After all that, the only thing they did for me was give me a reference # so I can either exchange it or return it without any issues. I work at Lowes, and I specifically purchased a Kobalt mower to support my company. Well, I can yell you this, that Kobalt mower is going back for a full tefund. I refuse to buy any more Kobalt products ever again, no matter how good the price. You get what you pay for.
reviews.author: Howe

reviews.title: "Love the mower, BUT…"
reviews.text: I love this mower.  It's easy to start, easy to handle, light, quiet.HOWEVER, I'm furious about the fact that Lowe's appears not to sell the battery for it!  What kind of store sells a piece of battery-operated equipment, but doesn't sell the battery for it?!?  I want a second battery, and I can't find one ANYWHERE.  This is, plain and simple, wrong.
reviews.author: Kathy

reviews.title: "Worst purchase I've made in a long time"
reviews.text: Bought this mower from Lowe's just last fall. Just moved across the country and decided I didn't want to deal with gasoline fumes and maintenance of a gasoline mower and was enticed by the idea of a cordless mower, thinking that battery technology has reached the point where it was possible (if a car can go 100 miles with a battery, a mower should be easy). I even got an extra battery, since my yard is around 0.3 acresHowever, the runtime doesn't come close to what they claim. Not even half. It takes 2 full batteries to mow just the front of my home, and about 3 to do the back yard. So, I basically have to mow every day of the week while charging the batteries overnight. It is a nightmare. I don't understand why the batteries are only 5 Ah. That is not enough at all.I can tell you this: this experience has convince me to never buy an electric car so long as I live.
reviews.author: James

reviews.title: "Pros and cons"
reviews.text: This is a lightweight mower and perfect for someone who is older or has back problems. A simple push of a button starts the mower. However, the battery runs out quickly especially if you use the propel. You will be lucky if you can get 10 minutes mowing if you use the propel. The battery takes a long time to recharge. Only good for small lawns.
reviews.author: Heidi

reviews.title: "Kobalt Mower"
reviews.text: Things I like about my Kobalt electric mower:No fuss,no muss, no fumes!So light weight, a self propelled feature is unnecessary.Folding feature for easy, space saving storage. No gas or oil to add to our pollution problem.Things I don't like:I had to purchase an extra battery(80.00) because 1 didn't last long enough.My South Florida Bermuda grass can be like cutting twigs. It often requires a second pass which my gas mower did not.Stopping at least twice to clean grass accumulated under the deck. I do not use a bag, mulch only. Bagging=wasted land fill space.
reviews.author: Ali

reviews.title: "Wheel"
reviews.text: I just bought this mower on Thursday and mowed my yard on Sunday. I was on the last strip when the wheel began to wobble and then fell off! This is not what I expect when I purchase something from Lowes! I'm sure I can fix it but that is not the point. I am ready to take it back and buy a gas mower!
reviews.author: John

reviews.title: "Much Better Than Expected"
reviews.text: Took less than 20 minutes to assemble. I started cutting right away and realized I needed to adjust deck height and did so with one hand. Then the battery died because it never dawned on me that I needed to give it a full charge...(sorry, I was excited to use my new lawn mower!) Anyways, charged it overnight, tackled the yard the next day. Performed like a champ. I have a .30 acre yard and this thing is perfect for it. Plenty of juice for me to cut both front and back on one charge but I do it over two days because I'd rather cut the grass, take a break, enjoy an ice cold refreshment and admire how awesome a freshly cut lawn looks. If I spread that out over two days it's basically double the enjoyment. You guys understand.Anyways, do your part to save the environment and buy this.
reviews.author: Matt

reviews.title: "More than expected!!!"
reviews.text: I was skeptical but purchased this mower to give it a chance while on sale.  The mower cut great and I was able to cut my entire yard(little over 1/4 acre) with one battery.  It was also much easier to start than my old gas mowers. I will be trying more tools in the line.
reviews.author: Charles

reviews.title: "It looks good on paper but doesn't deliver"
reviews.text: If you live in an area where grass grows well this mower can't handle it. I cut about 2 tenths of an acre and go through 3- 2.5 amp/hr batteries and one 5 amp/hr in the same day and often still can't finish the yard if I wait longer than a week to cut it. The side shoot is too small and the mower chokes out frequently from too much grass around the blades. I modified the ejection port to make it bigger and cut the grass on the second level to compromise.. works better but still chokes out very frequently. I cut the grass backwards to throw clippings outward instead of towards my next line, still doesn't work. If you cut your grass at LEAST once a week it might work. It worked decent in the beginning of the year but now that grass is thick I'm ready to throw it away.
reviews.author: Brian

reviews.title: "Kobalt 40V Brushless Mower"
reviews.text: Awesome mower, love it. Light weight and very easy to push. Does great job mowing... and battery is interchangeable with my Kobalt 40V weed eater! No worries about gas & oil, and battery last a lot longer than I expected. Perfect for the ladies that have to do their own lawn!
reviews.author: Debbie

reviews.title: "Not bad, but maybe a little underpowered"
reviews.text: I've had this for a few weeks now, and I'm still learning how best to handle it. It runs fairly well, much quieter than a gas mower, but it does seem to struggle with tall or wet grass -- a problem in springtime in western Oregon. Mowing my yard so far seems to involve several stops where the mower will shut down and start beeping; I have to wait a bit, back up, and restart more slowly. I don't know if I'm trying to take things too fast or what, but it does get irritating. Still, the grass does get mowed eventually and the whole process doesn't take much longer than I would have anticipated with a gas mower.
reviews.author: Morgan

reviews.title: "Wow!!!"
reviews.text: This thing is amazing! I haven't mowed in years, but I wanted to save some money by doing my lawn myself. I love technology and I don't drive, so getting gas and oil for a gas mower wasn't ideal. This however was perfect. It is so easy to use, so easy to maintain and the price was amazing. I'm not sure what I was expecting, but this thing is powerful. It far exceeded my expectations. My grass was very high and this had no problem getting it down. I have a decent sized frontside and backyard. This mower Its just as good or even better than a traditional lawn mower. Its like having a Tesla for your lawn lol!
reviews.author: T-CATT

reviews.title: "Works well, had battery or charger issue"
reviews.text: Comes out of the box very easy to use.  Good power and held a charge to complete the yard, about 40 minutes.  I used the mower approximately 4-5 times and then the next time I went to mow, no power.  I checked the charger and the battery.  I tried to recharge the battery on a different outlet-completely dead.  I went to the Lowe's where I purchased the mower, and they replaced the battery and charger, and the mower works perfectly again.
reviews.author: SpinBoy

reviews.title: "Battery is junk"
reviews.text: It's spring in Texas only 70*and cloudy 30 minutes in battery over heats.I have a corner lot, standard subdiv.size.Now I have waited 20 minutes for the battery to cool off,and it'll take another 75 minutes for my BRAND NEW battery to recharge. That'll bring me to about 3 hours to mow my front lawn.The mower is quiet and easy to push, only positive.Battery is expensive even if you have two batteries they don't recommend overcharging and it'll still take 75 minutes to charge your second one because it will not hold a charge overnight. I definitely regret buying this mower.
reviews.author: Bee

reviews.title: "My wife and I love this mower."
reviews.text: This mower is awesome, very lightweight, easy to maneuver, quite, sufficient battery power. Our front and back yards are about 2,000 sq. ft. each, this is the ideal mower for our yard. Bonus feature guys, my wife loves it and has already claimed it as her mower, just sayin.
reviews.author: Butch

reviews.title: "Battery sucks!"
reviews.text: I actually enjoy using this mower... For all 20 minutes that the battery stays charged. Then I have to take 2.5 hours go recharge it. So to mow my trailer park lawn (maybe 1/4 care) takes me at least 11-12 hours. Pretty sure when we were buying it the said it would only take about 30 minutes to charge and be able to mow about half an acre. We are very disappointed with this expnsive piece of crap.
reviews.author: AllDayMowing

reviews.title: "Great product"
reviews.text: This is a great mower! Lightweight and easy to start. I haven't had any issues with it since I bought back in early March.
reviews.author: JC

reviews.title: "Awesome!"
reviews.text: This is hands-down the best mower I have ever bought.  I was skeptical at first, if it would last or be strong enough since my grass tends to stay wet for a long time and it rains a lot here in Ohio, but to my great surprise, it cut right through it with no problem, and I still have plenty of battery charge left.  The greatest thing is it is so light! I don't get tired and so mowing and storing are a breeze.  A+ folks.
reviews.author: Jim

reviews.title: "Lowes Gen 2 40v Kobalt Mower is a Winner!"
reviews.text: Lowes has another winner with the new second generation 40 volt Kobalt mower.  The new brushless motor brings the quality of performance up to the same level as the 80 volt Kobalt which also has a brushless motor.  It's so easy to use; press the button, pull the lever and you are running.  Anyone can do it!  The unit is light and the power is uncompromised for a mower of this size.  It's ideal for lawns that are around 5000 square feet and you can easily mow your lawn and do most of your trimming and blowing w/ the 5ah battery that comes with it.  It trumps the E-Go mower that Home Depot sells with it's steel deck and for the money it simply can't be beat.  The other really cool thing is that the battery that comes with the mower, will also run the other 5 40 volt Kobalt tools that Lowes sells.  The string trimmer, blower, hedge trimmer, chain saw and pole saw all run on the same battery!  It's like taking the gas tank off one tool and running the others with it.  I've learned that once you have a couple tools w/ batteries, you can go to Lowes.com and order the others without the battery for a considerable savings.  For example, the bare mower is $70 less than the one that comes w/ the battery and charger!Unlike Home Depot, Lowes outdoor tool selection is complete in that I can buy every single tool I need to do all my lawn care work and run it on a single battery platform.  Home Depot carries more variety but it requires purchasing multiple batteries and that's the most expensive part of the cordless equation.  I highly recommend the 40 volt mower, especially now that the motor is brushless.  (By the way, the warranty is 5 years on the mower; 3 years on the battery.)  That's the best warranty out there!  Buy it and love it!
reviews.author: SuwaneeDon

reviews.title: "Does Not Mow Well"
reviews.text: I purchased this mower from Lowes at the beginning of the summer 2017. I previously had a Toro Gas Powered mower, and it cut my lawn perfectly, however I wanted to have a cordless mower as all of my other powered lawn tools were cordless as well and I love their simplicity.   I chose the Kobalt 40V Lawn Mower because I have had a great experience with all of my other cordless lawn tools I have purchased at Lowes, and I assumed I would have the same type of experience with this mower.I could have not been more wrong.  The mower does not cut my yards grass well at all.  Regardless of the number of times I mow over the same spot it seems to leave uncut grass.  When I mow the spot once it cuts about 95% of the grass, and upon a 2nd pass it cuts about 98% of the grass.  I have checked the rotation of the blade, as well as if the blade is sharp and all check out.  I have taken the mower back to my local Lowes store and they have offered no help to my problem, as my lawn mower technically is working.  This has absolutely been the worst purchase and experience.I have now resorted back to using my 5 year old Toro which works perfectly and cuts on the first pass.
reviews.author: JeffC

reviews.title: "Won't start and keeps beeping"
reviews.text: I bought this lawn mower yesterday. I unpacked, assembled, and read instructions. The battery was fully charged as indicated on the wall charger. Started up great and I started cutting the grass. During a large patch, the mower seized up - maybe too much grass. I stopped, cleaned out the undercarriage and tried to restart. It tries to start but just makes a beeping sound. I re-read the instructions and removed the battery and key then tried to restart. It would not. I did this 5 more times then wheeled it back to the drive way. I played around a few more times then it started working again. It quickly seized again. Tired to repeat all the steps above and nothing. I called customer service and their only suggestion was to do what I already did then they said to return in lol. Now I have to try to take it apart, put it back in the box, and drive back to Lowe's. This was my first experience with an electric mower, not a great start :-(
reviews.author: Dallasguy

reviews.title: "Get this mower!"
reviews.text: My neighbor got this mower back in April and I borrowed his until I could save for a new one. I have about a 45 min to an hour worth of cut time and his never died on me and mine is great. It charges quickly and has a battery indicator on it. One of my favorite things about this mower is it senses when it is going through a thicker patch and the motor ramps up to get through it. If you have super thick grass and want to cut it really short than maybe this mower isn't for you, but for a standard lawn it works great!
reviews.author: Jim

reviews.title: "Weak and Pathetic"
reviews.text: Seriously? Stalls when hitting dandelions. Doesn't mulch at all. The battery doesn't last as advertised. I went to buy another 40V 5.0Ah battery. They don't make them. Ended up buying a 40V 2.5Ah one, charged it up to full. Lasted half the amount. Still didn't finish the front yard!  So I returned it all!! I was told they are discontinuing it because of all the problems with it. Buyer Beware!!
reviews.author: Grassy

reviews.text: Quality battery powered mower with good cutting power and steel deck for durability.  My favorite feature is the 'Quick Change' cutting height adjustment .  You can raise and lower all 4 wheels with one easy-to-use lever!
reviews.author: LC

reviews.title: "very short battery life"
reviews.text: My experience is that the battery dies in less than 15 minutes.  Today the battery died in 12 minutes.  (That was after charging for more than 24 hours.)  Maybe I have a defective battery, I don't know.  (One hour of charging time gets me about 3 minutes of battery life.)    Cutting my lawn is a 30-minute job, but with this lawnmower, it's 12 minutes a day for 3 days.  I would not recommend this product.
reviews.author: Chris

reviews.title: "Faulty batteries"
reviews.text: Fancy they'd offer 3 years battery warranty, because you'll definitely file a claim by year 2.  But first, you will hold on the line for at least 20 min.  Then IF someone answers, they'll offer you a totally different number for their very challenged battery department- where you'll hold at least another 20 minutes for a human (if at all).  Below is the actual number for Kobalt's battery suport team (save it because you'll need it): (855) 854-3057
reviews.author: cwellt

reviews.title: "Awful Lawnmower. Do not buy this from Lowes!!!"
reviews.text: Bought the mower about two months ago, trying to get away from the gas powered mower.  The battery life is ridiculous!!  Looks like Lowe's does not carry any bigger for this any longer.  We can cut the grass for only 10-15 minutes on a fully charged battery.  Almost useless!
reviews.author: Travis

reviews.title: "Pleasantly Suprised"
reviews.text: I am replacing a 17 Year Old Craftsman 7.5 HP 21" self propelled mower with the 40V Max Kobalt. It is actually awesome. I fold it for storage, takes up little room. Even with the grass a bit high it will do my whole yard with half the charge left. I have an almost double size lot in a residential neighborhood. When the grass is a bit high from my self proclaimed laziness, it just speeds the blade up to assist in cutting. We will see what the longevity is of it, but the mower itself has a 3 year warranty and the battery has a 5 year warranty.
reviews.author: Kevin

reviews.title: "Meh"
reviews.text: I love the idea of being battery powered. It starts up real easy. No having to pull cord, it's quieter and doesn't have that hard vibration. I've only had this few days now and I'm not keeping it. After a full charge on the battery and outside temp in mid 70s it lasted bout 10 mins. Then have to leave battery in house few hrs to cool down before putting on charge. I can barely cut any grass before it over heats and drains battery. Gas mover will keep on cutting through all that. Grass isn't long at all. Just a little thick in spots. I probably should have gone with 80v but don't see diff in motor.
reviews.author: Romp

reviews.title: "Would be 5 Stars with better battery life"
reviews.text: Purchased this today, brought it home, charged the battery and went to work on my 1/3 acre.  I love everything about this mower.  Light, quiet and the folding storage is awesome.  I was able to power through my front and back yard on a single charge.  Here's the problem; it comes with a 5 amp battery, but Lowe's only sells a 2.5 amp if you want to get an extra.  I'm thinking of the fall when you sometimes cut your grass over and over until you get to the lowest level so you can aerate and seed.  One battery won't cut it.  These should come with two 5 amp batteries.  If you can't get at least one hour on a charge, you should comp a backup battery.  Otherwise, great and when I flipped it over to clean it...no oil or gas to spill all over the place
reviews.author: Maxrandb

reviews.title: "40v Mower"
reviews.text: It works better then I thought it would, I mowed the backyard, both sides of it and then the front yard all 5 sides. We are on a corner lot, so we have a lot of mowing needed. So when I finished all the mowing, it still had 1 bar of battery left, so I put it in my edger and finished that whole task, leaving me my blower with it's own 2.5 ah battery to finish the job! I really love how it stands up right and I can just put it in my shed and have it not take up any extra room. It's nice and quiet, starts up super easy. Basically it's ready out of the box. I love all my kobalt tools!!
reviews.author: Chris

reviews.title: "Underwhelming performance"
reviews.text: Try as I might, I cannot get more than 1/8 acre done without needing to recharge the battery. I do not use the self-propelled feature, lest I get even less mowed before a recharge is needed. It takes 2 days to mow 1/2 an acre yard. For the price, it should at least include 2 batteries.
reviews.author: Keith

reviews.title: "Doesn't do the job and is weak"
reviews.text: The mower doesn't do the job at all. I mow my lawn every two weeks and not only does the battery not last but, every time I come up against a think part of grass it cuts out. Pretty disappointed in my purchase. My lawn is less than 500 sq ft and the battery doesn't last. I can cut about half-ish of my lawn before it dies and I have to recharge the battery.
reviews.author: Adrian

reviews.title: "Does a great job on the grass! My yard looks great"
reviews.text:
This mower is very easy to use and took no time to set it up ready to use.
It did a great job on my yard. It was a bit hard to mow up hill as I like to go up and down to 
create a nice pattern in front.

I had to take a few try's to put the battery in the charger until I saw the groves in the did to guid it in all the way.

Over a excellent but would be better if it was self propelled. However, I do understand limitations being 
Battery powered. It is light weight and easy to turn and menuver around.
reviews.author: Chuck

reviews.title: "FRUSTRATING"
reviews.text: I live in central Virginia, where it typically rains at least two-three times per week in the summer.  This lawnmower is awful, and I'm not even sure why they sell it here.  If the grass is the least bit damp, this lawnmower will clog up within 10 feet of pushing it. I have half of an acre, all together, and I typically have to charge the battery 3-4 times go cut the whole yard, which takes 2+ days.  The battery takes at least an hour to cool down after using (duh, it's lithium), and then another two-plus hours to charge. They say that the battery is supposed to last an hour, but even with dry, short grass, I have gotten 30 minutes, max.  When the grass is damp, I get maybe 15-20. This whole summer has been a nightmare when it comes to lawn care, all because of this "mower".  I will be saving my money this winter, and purchasing a new lawnmower in the spring.
reviews.author: Unhappylawn

reviews.title: "Battery will not last"
reviews.text: purchased ot today and charged the battery to 100%. The lawn mower did not even complete the back yeard 2/3 in total and still had the front. Took it back 4 hours after purchasing and got a gas self-prop. For the dame price. They were on dale today for $249.99. I will never waste my time with an electric again. Yes, grass was avout 3 in tall. So it was not thst. And my yard was completly dry as well. If you have a yard that is 10x10 your solid. Other than that go with the gas mower. No, my yard is smaller than a 1/3 acre as well.
reviews.author: RJ

reviews.title: "Avoid this mower"
reviews.text: Short run time (up to 20 minutes with 5.0Ah battery).  Running as mulching mower is a joke.  Bagging performance is poor as well. Replacement 5.0Ah batteries are expensive and special order item.
reviews.author: mas

reviews.title: "Great mower..but..."
reviews.text: I purchased this mower a week ago. I have already used it a couple of times. It cuts great. I love the height adjustment for cutting higher grass. The only downfall is the battery life. I've been able to get 40 minutes from it, sometimes less depending on if I'm mowing at an incline, etc. I wanted to purchase a back up battery so I won't have to stop and wait to charge the one I have. Unfortunately, it has been out of stock. It's very frustrating that something with such a high demand isn't being being produced quickly enough to accommodate customers. Extremely disappointing.
reviews.author: lou23

reviews.title: "Battery fails to charge"
reviews.text: This was a purchase we made thinking it sounded fantastic.  We have a small yard.  We successfully mowed our yard once.  The battery is fully charged but will NOT POWER the mower at all.  It seems the battery must have died, but the mower was only used once.  Buyer beware
reviews.author: Mom

reviews.title: "replacement blades?"
reviews.text: You cannot buy replacement blades for this mower.  Go ahead, try.  I'll be here waiting.
reviews.author: rpoe

reviews.title: "Honestly, better than I'd expected."
reviews.text: I've used push mowers for over 30 years.  While this isn't something you'd use for commercial use or for a large property, for a small property it will get the job done.  If you need to deal with high/thick grass, then raise the deck and work your way down.  Just like you would for any *other* push mower.  I've had no issues with battery life.  Indeed, if you keep up with mowing regularly, you won't necessarily find that the battery lasts *longer*, but you might find yourself getting more area taken care of in a shorter period of time.The only significant complaint is the lack of readily purchasable adequate replacements for the battery that comes with it.  I'd be nice to be able to do so where I purchased it.
reviews.author: Christopher

reviews.title: "Great electronics, poor design"
reviews.text: I just purchased and assembled this this week. Lots of plastic is used in components for handles, shields and more. The shield for the side discharge fell off twice while I was using the unit in the first half hour and was run over by the blade each time. Needless to say, it is now damaged and I doubt it will stay in place while in normal use. I am going to call Kobalt support. I am unsure if I will return this unit which clearly suffers from inadequate design.
reviews.author: GeoFLL

reviews.title: "Terrible battery"
reviews.text: The  lawnmower is fine works well, but I urge you to read the reviews of the battery. If you're lucky they will last year and the replacement is $150.00.
reviews.author: Jmk

reviews.title: "very disappointing piece of junk, no power at all"
reviews.text: this thing will not cut through 6 inch tall grass on level 2 setting for closeness, would go for a few feet and then shut off because of the grass being stuck under it, and this is supposed to be a powerful motor.  battery only lasts enough to do my lawn in front of my house which is about 200 square feet - this is the first and last time i will be buying Kobalt - VERY DISAPPOINTING... I SUGGEST FOR YOU TO SAVE YOUR MONEY AND BUY A REPUTABLE BRAND FOR A FEW MORE BUCKS.  THIS THING HAS NO POWER AND BATTERY DOESN'T LAST!!!
reviews.author: mike

reviews.title: "Kobalt 40 volt mower"
reviews.text: Bought this mower got it home charged the battery several hours ( fully charged)  put it in and Nothing!!  Called Kobalt   I might as well called myself  All they could say is return it for exchange!!  My response was return it for refund!!!   VERY VERY poor customer service!!!
reviews.author: jim

reviews.title: "Poor battery life, misses lots of grass blades"
reviews.text: This is my first electric mower, so maybe this is normal. I've got two main gripes after about 8 mows. 1. Some mows the battery doesn't cut the whole 4000sf yard. Then when I try to charge the battery it overheats in the charger and I have to pull it off. Last time it took about four hours before I could get two bars of charge to finish the lawn. Though tonight it cut the whole yard no problem. First time I used it I got two passes on a charge, see #2 for why I needed two.2. It misses a lot of grass blades. No particular pattern, all different parts of the path (center and sides). Maybe a little better when the motor is spinning fastest. So many missed blades it almost takes two passes, see point 1. I'll start with sharpening the blade, though it looks great.I really like the low maintenance and lack of gas in the garage, but may go back to Dino fuel if these battery and cutting issues cannot be resolved.
reviews.author: Matthew

reviews.title: "Cool idea, but won't mow over 20 minutes"
reviews.text: Great concept and ran really good for 20 minutes. Prob good for small yards...not ready for the average city lawn yet.20 minutes tops for one battery and takes a long time to recharge.
reviews.author: Dale

reviews.title: "Exceeded my expectations"
reviews.text: Researched what size battery I should get and looked at what other tools use the same battery. Purchased the 40w, topped off the battery, and went to work. It was surprising light to push and much quieter than gas motor. Front and back yards together are less than 1/4 acre and flat. I was able to mow front and back with battery power to spare. The mower added power in thicker grass when needed. One handle easily adjusts all 4 wheels at the same time, which is a great innovation. Specs indicate 2.5 hours for a full charge which was faster than other makes. But my first charge after it was completely depleted was less. I was able to take the battery out of the mower and pop it into the Kobalt 40w trimmer to get more work out of the trimmer, which has a smaller capacity battery. Looking forward to using it again and adding more 40w tools.
reviews.author: Norm

reviews.title: "Great surprise"
reviews.text: I was an battery powered mower skeptic.  But I used this battery powered Kobalt and was blown away.  It cuts no different than a gas mower, only diff is you dont have ringing ears and smell like exhaust fumes.  This isnt for a large piece of property, unless you buy a couple of batteries.  Not that the batteries die fast they just charge slow.  But for my little piece of earth in this neighborhood it the perfect mower.  I highly recommend.  Save the planet, your great great grandkids will thank you for it. Peace
reviews.author: Rxmo9

reviews.title: "started off good but got worse"
reviews.text: Had this mower for about a year, and along with buying it i also bought a spare battery. My lawn is quite small and i was told a single battery would be sufficient. From day 1, the single battery would not really get through the lawn, but we had the back-up so things were fine. i just swapped them out. now it is to the point where two batteries no longer complete the job and i have to spend 1 hour for the batteries to cool before charging and another 2 hours minimum to charge them. I hate devoting an entire Sunday to nothing but mowing my small lawn.
reviews.author: Jeff

reviews.title: "The best mower, pound for pound, dollar for dollar"
reviews.text: This is a very light push mower, 25% lighter than comparable gas mowers.  The cut is consistent, the blade speed kicks up in taller or thicker grass.This is not the most expensive model but it gives you all the options for grass clippings.The battery charge is ample, I cut my suburban lawn on less than 70% of the battery.  The battery detaches from the mower for convenience.  The whole thing folds up vertically, you can store it in a coat closet if you had to. I know even with age, for me, this is the right tool for the job.
reviews.author: Vito

reviews.title: "Great Mower, highly recommend."
reviews.text: I just purchased this mower (20 inch 5Ah battery) on 9/27/2018. It took 2.5 hrs to charge the battery from dead cold out of the box. Assembly was a just putting on the bolts to the handle. Cut our yard (2000 sq ft) in 28 minutes. The battery indicator shows 1/3 of the power was used. The grass is thick St. Augustine in FL about 5” tall. Used the bagging option and mower set to the 4 (middle) height, will use 5 the next time. It is fairly light but sturdy. The grass looks great. It was nice not having to mess with gasoline or oil and that you can store the mower in a vertical orientation with the handle folded down. Was unsure if the battery could get it done but it did with power to spare. I highly recommend this mower.
reviews.author: jmc

reviews.title: "Great Product & Great Kobalt Customer Service!"
reviews.text: Have had my mower almost 3 years now. Battery is getting a bit worn out, but still works at about 75%. This is normal for any battery, especially living in South Florida where I mow year round and often. Mower does a great job, is super quiet  (neighbors luv that) and have had no issues whatsoever. Kobalt is sending me out a new battery no charge and both departments I talked with were 5 star PLUS! Even more important, one was just outside Detroit, MI and the other in Canada, so no communication problems and jobs kept here and with our neighbors to the North. I will continue to purchase anything Kobalt makes and I highly commend & recommend this company! Thank you :)  NOTE: Do not get this mower wet. Store battery in a cool, dark place. Let battery cool down BEFORE charging and do not overcharge.
reviews.author: JDL

reviews.title: "Limited Battery life"
reviews.text: Have less than 1/4 Acre and can't get thru it on one charge.Then the battery is too hot to re-charge. Additional 5AH batteries are currently unavailable.Hopefully the grass doesn't grow too fast this season.
reviews.author: Ed

reviews.title: "Great for small yards and quietness but thats all"
reviews.text: I've owned this for about a year now and can confidently provide accurate review.  If you are looking for a light duty mower, for a small to medium sized yard and hate refueling your loud mower with gas, this is for you.  When you insert a full battery into this and start it up it's a different ball game altogether, I get people asking me all the time why its so quiet not to mention how light it is.  But that's where all the good go, that aside, like I said it's not useful for medium to large yards at all, save your money, time and energy, don't stress yourself out because this is a battery drainer. I bought an extra battery ($125+) from the Kobalt because with only one, I could only finish half my backyard in about an inch and a half grass. It stalls if you go too fast, the side discharge gets clogged up and don't even try mulching cause it won't work.  Altogether in the attached picture took me "4" batteries (2 battery, recharged full charge the next day). And you can't recharge them right away because it's too hot so you'll have to do this overnight.
