I would say, don't let this new technology, the quietness and sleek design sway you away from the more powerful gas alternative.
reviews.author: Chong

reviews.title: "Does the job"
reviews.text: Works well, really quiet, battery is enough to mow my entire yard (it's not very big).
reviews.author: Stray

reviews.title: "Well-built electric mower"
reviews.text: This is my 2nd year with this electric mower. Kobalt has made a stellar product. I purchased an extra battery with it from the start.I use this to do trimming on a .4 acre yard with a lot of landscaping. I seriously think I could do the whole yard with this, in a pinch.It is super light weight and requires little effort to move around. This is not the self-propelled version as it's not needed because it is so light.The mower has a sensor that will power up in heavier, deeper spots, and it keeps right on going.It's a great electric mower. Battery-life was what I expected; keep them charged in between jobs.
reviews.author: elmoreohio

reviews.title: "Excellent"
reviews.text: Used by 87 year old mom she loves it pushes easy it's a winner
reviews.author: Nancy

reviews.title: "Going back!"
reviews.text: This is my 2nd kobolt electric mower. First one was recalled and now the replacement is having battery issues. I'm now on my 2nd battery and having the same issue as the first. I do everything by the book and I'm so frustrated! After waiting 2wks for the new battery I call to check shipping status and they tell me 20 more days!
reviews.author: C

reviews.title: "Can't mow front & back yard if I mulch"
reviews.text: We became full time RV's in 03.  Wife broke her leg & was in a wheel chair for 14 months she could not get in our fifth wheel so we got a nice little house.  Have not had mower in well over 10 years and with a small yard got the 40V mower & it will mow the yard, if I don't use mulch.  Why fertilize when I can mulch.  When I use mulch I can't mow both front & back yard so it takes two days to mow my yard.  So not happy with the 40V mower.  The best thing that happened to me was the battery to die in a little under two years as the mower was bought in 16.  Called Kobalt they said go to Lowe's & get a new battery well Lowe's does not have any 5A batteries just the 2.5A batteries in stock.  Lowe's could not have been nicer they called Kobalt & said it would take at least 3 weeks to get another battery or could trade it in for a new mower.  I ask if I paid the different between a 40V & the 80V, could I upgrade, they said yes.  So I now the 80V mower & the difference is night & day.  First it has 2 batteries but I can mow both front & back on only 1 battery.  By the time I got the new mower my grass was a little high the 80V just kicked up a little faster & kept going & done the entire yard in mulch mode on only 1 battery!  The 40V would bog down in high grass & in mulch just eat up the battery.  The 40V was ok with out mulch but with mulch it was very week.  Very happy that I now have the 80V,  Like I said the 40V was just a little weak would not buy again.  A little like getting out of a Ford Ranger into a Diesel Super Duty.
reviews.author: red

reviews.title: "Loved it at first ,But returning it"
reviews.text: I bought this mower on 7-2-18 and used it the next day it worked great,So yesterday was the second time trying to use it an it worked for about 15mins cut half of my small yard and stopped and never started back up, It was at a full battery charged when we started but cut off on 4 green bars so I no it wasn't the battery.
reviews.author: DaNalle

reviews.title: "great mower"
reviews.text: Had debated getting one with more power and also self-propelled.  But my property is flat and I only have a quarter acre (with the house).  So not a lot of lawn.  My coworker convinced me that this mower was plenty and he was right!  Used it once and it was even quieter than I expected, very light and easy to push around and plenty of battery to do my whole lawn.  In fact, I used whatever charge was in the battery when I opened the box without charging and was able to finish my lawn.  Very happy.
reviews.author: Acesq

reviews.title: "Great mower, just have to know limitations"
reviews.text: Have had for a year and I love this mower so much more than our old small gas powered one. It's quiet and starts instantly and makes mowing our lawn something I almost look foreword too! A few things - lot size, 1/5 acre no problem, any bigger and you will be needing a second battery or taking a break between front and back to charge. Also, it works awesome if you keep on top of mowing. If you have really tall grass (2 weeks growing..) you can't just plow through at a low deck height - it just does not have the power. I do a knock down pass at max height, then a second pass at 2-3 and it's fine. Also it gets bogged down a bit with wet grass. Overall once you learn how to work around it's limitations in raw power it's fantastic.
reviews.author: EP

reviews.title: "Just can't cut it."
reviews.text: My yard is maybe 1/8 acre. No hills. This mower makes it a third of the way through before the battery dies or gets too hot. 5 hours of recharging later, its ready to tackle the next third. And by tackle, I mean stall out every time it encounters slightly thicker grass or rolls over a clump of cut grass. In the summer time, this means every 3 feet. This mower is pathetic. I have returned it and bought a gas powered one that actually works.
reviews.author: John

reviews.title: "Disappointed"
reviews.text: I was so excited about this lawn mower. It is light and the battery lasts a long time. Buy this mower ONLY if your lawn is level and easy to mow. The self propelled feature of this mower is  misrepresented by the maker. It is the hardest mower I have ever pushed and I have pushed a few!  It will NOT go uphill, so I find myself mowing my lawn according to the considerable limitations of this Kobalt mower. I am so glad I did not give my gasoline powered Torro away! Otherwise, I would be sitting here exhausted, with trembling arms, a pulled muscle in my back, and no way to mow the rest of my lawn.
reviews.author: Disappointed

reviews.text: First, I remember standing in the return line at Lowe's and saw somebody return this unit stating the battery didn't hold up. So I was happy to review this product when I had an opportunity too. I have an average size yard my lot is 60 by 110 my house sits in the middle and isn't very large. When I first set the unit up I noticed right off that it was very light, but not in a bad way, it was light but sturdy, you could tell it was quality material. I Read through the owner's manual and charged the battery which only took a few hours. I was able to cut all of my lawn still having one bar left on the battery, It took some getting used to, because it's battery operated it has a startup process which is relatively easy but then the motor and Battery cycle probably to cool it off, but it still cuts grass while while it's going through this cycle. I would say that before you purchase this item make sure that it's the right fit for your yard, if you have a big yard I would look at this unit as a 2 cut process with a battery charge in the middle like I said only takes a few hours to charge it. It all depends on what you're looking to accomplish and your time frame. If you get home from work late and cut your grass after work this would be a great unit it's quiet and would not disturb anybody so with that said, it did a great job on my lawn.
reviews.author: RLemke

reviews.title: "Very Upset With My Purchase"
reviews.text: I purchased this product when we purchased our new home in June of 2018. I have a very small yard that consists of 1/4 acre and it takes me 3 charges to get my yard mowed. The grass is not thick and if for some reason I miss a week of not mowing (due to rains, etc.)I have to use my weed eater to cut the thick areas first before I can even think about running this mower through the grass. I live in Florida and we are having very mild weather and un-seasonal warmth which we are already starting to mow. I have found that the (one) battery (and to purchase a spare is not an option and not available) that comes with the mower will take up to "3" charges just to get through my front yard now. It also takes several hours to re-charge and this is embarrassing. This was entirely a waste of money and I would never expect to find a product like this at Lowes. I should have stayed with my "gas" powered mower!
reviews.author: Bo

reviews.title: "A Really Great Mower for the Money"
reviews.text: I purchased one of these last season to replace my corded electric mower.  I was tired of dragging the cord around.  I was also tired of buying new cords when the old ones got cut by the old mower.  I toyed around with getting the 80-Volt mower but decided not to because I have two 40-volt batteries for my string trimmer and hedge clipper. I was not sure if the cordless mower had the power to cut high grass.  I should not have worried.  It is a real beast.The battery for the 40-volt mower is 5 An “extended run” version versus 2 Ah “Quick Charge” versions that came with my older string trimmer and hedge clipper.  The 5 Ah battery is heavier, but both size batteries fit in the mower and the chargers.  The 5 Ah battery lasts longer, but with three batteries, I can cut 3/4 acre of lawn without stooping.  For example, I just "dethatched" my lawn with the height setting at 1.  I was very impressed with the power of this mower and how well the bag picked up all of the clippings.  I especially like how the mower automatically shifts into high speed when the grass gets thick.  I did not expect that and love it.  It literally never bogs down.  This feature shortens the battery life, to be sure, but I've never run into grass that is too high for this cordless mower . . . and that's cool.
reviews.author: JNDAustin

reviews.title: "Excellence"
reviews.text: I love this thing. Not sure where to start. Set up is extremely easy, it starts with easy, it has good power, it maneuvers easily around the yard, sounds like a ceiling fan on high. I am able to mow back and front yard on one charge. Now my backyard mowing area is small because of the playground area, fire pit area and a little natural area. If you are expecting gas powered mover power or the ability to mow a large yard on one charge you will be disappointed.
reviews.author: Kobaltking

reviews.title: "I think it's a good lawn mower"
reviews.text: I think what most of you can see and what I found out is that the battery just doesnt last that long. Maybe 20 to 30 mins which isnt much cutting even for a small to medium lawn. Reading more reviews everyone pretty much is saying the same thing you need another battery or go with the step up with the 2 batteries and fast charging. In my opinion either way between cutting,swapping batteries and charging fast or not it's either going to take hours or days depending on if you have the time. Going to look for a corded one but probably a different brand.
reviews.author: AjBuie

reviews.title: "Perfect for 1/3 acre leaf-mulching"
reviews.text: I'm finishing up my second season using this nifty little workhorse for mulching oak leaves in a homeowners' association common area that's a little over 1/3 acre. I cross-cut the leaves back and forth in several directions to get them finely mulched, so it would actually be fine for a larger size lot if you're going over it just once. Have had no problems at all with the battery - I read in several places to let it cool down completely before sticking back in the recharger and maybe that's the magic trick. I'm 60 so the light weight of the mower is perfect, it's quite easy to push (I also don't let the leaves get too thick between sessions, cutting about once a week for 5 big old oaks)and the 40v battery that comes with the mower lasts as long as I do for getting a good mulch of the space in one session. I don't use the bag attachment, too small for a big area without making a lot of stops to empty it, I just cut with the side-hatch open and get a fine enough cut that the leaf-bits either blow away or replenish the soil. Storage is easy and not having to deal with a gas engine is wonderful. Very happy with this purchase, for my purposes this is a perfect little machine!
reviews.author: CarolTheGardener

reviews.title: "Poor mower run time"
reviews.text: Takes over 11 batteries to mow my small yard. Very disappointed in the performance after 3 months.
reviews.author: Chris

reviews.title: "Nice mower"
reviews.text: The assembly of the mower is straight forward. The battery charges in relatively short time. I like that I can store it not only folded down but also in a vertical position. There are safety switches which prevent the mower being started in a "non mowing position". There is also a safety "switch" which if removed prevents the mower being started in any situation. Great if you have young ones who want to play with things they shouldn't. I love the fact that you have three mowing modes - mulch, side discharge and also you can pick up cuttings by installing the bag on the back. Although it is not self propelled it is easy to push. I think it would be harder if you have a long blade grass like St Augustine. All in all I am impressed with it.
reviews.author: dhpw

reviews.title: "Great mower"
reviews.text: After 1st use I give it a 5 star review. It last more than enough on one batter to mow my 1/4 acre plot. It clogged a few times and shut off, but that was user error not the mower. As a 30 something woman I had never mowed in my life! It was easy to put together and use and I did it myself. I am certainly NOT mechanically inclined. I recommend this mower for newbies like myself!
reviews.author: Sarah

reviews.title: "Gets the job done!"
reviews.text: I bought this mower to cut around obstacles and overgrowth on hills that I could not cut with my tractor.  It works efficiently, engaging a "second gear" when cutting through thicker grass.  It handled 8" high overgrowth on a 45-degree hill with ease!  Battery lasts surprisingly long.  I only drained 50% of the battery after mowing for about a half hour on challenging terrain.  Easy start, super quiet operation and, best of all, no fumes!  Handle folds down for easy storage.  Recommended for small yards and 30-45-minute edging/detail mowing.
reviews.author: Rob

reviews.title: "terrible battery/great mower"
reviews.text: When I first got this mower I loved it. It's easy to use and, when new, cut the entire yard. (My yard is not very big.) Unfortunately, three months later, the battery won't even make it through a third of the yard. I bought a trimmer that uses the same battery, so I have two batteries which I charge fully, and can't get through the yard with two batteries! This is not practical or acceptable. My yard is never fully mowed because I can only do part of it. By the time I get to the other part, a few days later, the recently mowed part looks scraggly. On top of that, one of my batteries now seems to be completely dead. The light on the charger is red. With one battery it will take me all week to get the lawn mowed in sections. Because of the terrible batteries, I regret buying this mower and would not recommend it to anyone.
reviews.author: KB

reviews.title: "EVERYTHING"
reviews.text: Battery died so quickly.Blades are not sharp enough for first time use it does not even feel like yard was mowed.
reviews.author: Nama

reviews.title: "No Replacement Blades Available, Poor Quality Batt"
reviews.text: I bought this mower in the Spring of 2017 along with a 40V Kobalt chainsaw that uses the same batteries. I absolutely LOVED it the first year! Plenty of power and battery life - it was perfect for my small yard. I did have some battery issues, though. Batteries would suddenly be unable to be charged, with the charger showing a bad cell indication. If left on the charger long enough (weeks or months) the pack would resurrect itself. Go figure... Since I had two packs it wasn't that big of a problem for me.The trouble came the next spring (2018) and trying to find a replacement blade. In short, THERE ISN"T ANY. After going to several Lowes stores and chatting with Lowes.com it became obvious that they simply don't carry a replacement blade (though they didn't actually admit it). I ended up buying a blade sharpening kit and got the original blade sharp enough to cut reasonably. Note: This is difficult due to the curvy design of the lightweight blade. Note also that should you bend the blade it is likey to render the mower useless. Remember: no blades are available. I plan to eek out the remainder of the season with this mower but replace it with aother electric next spring (2019). I will NOT replace it with a Kobalt! Hopefully the big name toomakers stand behind their products better than I found here!
reviews.author: Bladeless-in-Cincinnati

reviews.title: "Nothing but disappointment"
reviews.text: I bought this mower figuring it would be the easiest option for me. However I have used it 2 times and am highly disappointed. The battery life does not meet expectations and the mower frequently stalls. Customer service is less than helpfu and has high wait times.
reviews.author: Allison

reviews.title: "Not what i was hoping for"
reviews.text: I bought this to use in our court yard at work. I thought having a low maintenance easy to start push mower was the way to go. It was so easy to put together. Most of the mower is plastice pieces which i am not sure will hold up. Unfortunately the battery life is horrible. I was only able to now for 20 minutes before it cut off and now it just keeps blinking red on the charger. It runs super quiet and easy to use but the battery life is not worth the price.
reviews.author: Karen

reviews.title: "SoSo mower"
reviews.text: This is a good lawnmower for a very little yard. My yard is about a 10th of an acre. this lawnmower lasts about 30 to 45 minutes. it lacks the power. it's made for well manicured lawns. if your grass grows about 2 to 3 inches and is a little moist this machine jams. I now have to buy 2 more batteries so I don't get stuck with half of my lawn done.
reviews.author: giloaded

reviews.title: "Poor Quality"
reviews.text: Mower ran fine and cut fine, but on the 4th use the weld for the back wheel broke off.  Not worth the $$, bought a cheap gas mower as replacement.
reviews.author: Mark

reviews.title: "Worked great for a year!!!"
reviews.text: Loved this mower until last week. It's a year old and will start up for about 45 secs then dies!! My battery is at 100%. Called the 888-3kobalt. Customer service rep was great said it's a connection issue when it beeps twice and dies. Willing to send new battery but it's not the battery. Then the rep suggested that I take it back to Loews and have them check the connection issue or replace my unit. 5 year warranty on the unit from date of purchase or from the date on the s/n. 3 year warranty on the battery. Hey we go! Wish me luck!!!
reviews.author: Heather

reviews.title: "Battery does NOT last. Buyer BEWARE!!"
reviews.text: Mower worked great for about 6 mows.  Only used about half of a battery charge after mowing for at most 20 minutes on a tiny little lawn.  Now, after a month of use, it doesn't hold even 15 minutes of charge.  Can't even mow a small lawn with this garbage.  Will be calling Warranty department now to see how well they handle this.
reviews.author: ChrisR

reviews.title: "Amazing Improvement!"
reviews.text: This is my second electric lawn maintenance tool replacement. The other would be chainsaw. Amazed at how t how quiet your mind quite it runs. I cannot overstate the pleasure of not having to deal with pulling to crank! No gas or oil to worry with or smell! Cut great cut about 1/2 acre without any lag in the battery.
reviews.author: lotsofworkfornoresults

reviews.title: "Where have you been all my life ??"
reviews.text: I am impressed (not easily done). I own a gas powered mower with the motor that will start in two pulls. Having had extensive surgery and some removal of muscle in one shoulder even one pull is difficult. In addition it stalls out in slightly high grass. Now....onto the Kobalt mower. Good weight. The folding feature is nice where storage is a problem. Very easy to maneuver. I use only where my riding mower won't go. The 40 amp battery is a 5 AH. I have a Kobalt weed eater and the batteries will exchange. A big plus for me. I do not know how long the battery will last but it is more than sufficient for my use. Now I can trim mow on Saturday or Sunday morning at 7:00 am and not wake my neighbors. Now if Kobalt would just come up with a riding mower........
reviews.author: oldman22

reviews.title: "Bad batteries"
reviews.text: The mower cuts very well, but the batteries sometimes need to be recharged several times before they will successfully recharge.Lowes does not have an inventory of batteries in the store so you will wait a week. If your grass is long the city may fine you before the battery gets in. The battery is half the cost of a new mower so Lowes is basically pushing people into buying a new mower every 3 years. The battery should be way cheaper than $130.
reviews.author: Mike

reviews.title: "Excited at First..."
reviews.text: My husband and I bought this as what we believed to be an easier alternative to buying a brand new gas powered mower. Our lot is around 1/4 acre and has some small hills. When we first got the mower, the battery would last for the entire yard cutting. We have had this mower a little more than a month and are incredibly disappointed in the battery life, as now it will only cut about a third of the yard before it dies on us and we have to wait to get it charged back up again. We also purchased the battery operated weed eater also, and have had nothing but issues with its battery not wanting to last. We chose this mower because we didn't feel like we wanted to waste time with gas, and also it was a lightweight mower for me to operate as I am six months pregnant. If the batteries weren't such an issue, I would have given it a solid four stars.
reviews.author: SamiSami

reviews.title: "I really wanted to like this mower..."
reviews.text: I just bought this mower yesterday and I was really excited to use it. That is until I actually did use it. I just went to mow my lawn which is very small in size and about 10-15 minutes in, it shut off. Apparently the battery overheated (it is about 70° outside). It also struggled to cut my grass (which is mostly weeds) and would often shut off due to its struggles, but turn back on (aside from this last time). Im going to give it another shot once the battery cools down but, needless to say, i'm a little disappointed.
reviews.author: alex

reviews.title: "Battery doesn't last"
reviews.text: Bought the mower a year ago and the battery has been getting worse with each use.  Battery has a guarantee of 3 years, but if you take it back you have to take the whole thing, mower and all back, at least that's what my Lowes is making me do. I will be going to another brand, the strong trimmer didn't even last a full year and has same problems.  Batteries had been in a air conditioned area so climate not a factor.
reviews.author: Abe

reviews.title: "Terrible Mower"
reviews.text: I have had this mower for a year and it has went from being an excellent mower to a pile of junk in that time! Now I am extremely upset that they won't honor their 3 year warranty. So with that being said I could not recommend this mower to anyone!
reviews.author: Jon

reviews.title: "hampered by battery life"
reviews.text: The mower works well and is relatively quiet.  The real problem is that the battery just isn't up to the task.  My lawn isn't that large (whole property is 1/4 acre including the house) and I need 3 batteries to mow the whole thing.  My mower came with one battery and the other two batteries are from the 40V Kobalt 13" trimmer and leaf blower that I also bought.One of the problems that needs to be addressed is that the batteries get warm and deactivate themselves.  So, you do not always get the full run time from each battery until it cools down---and this takes a long time.  We have had mild weather this spring and I wonder how bad the battery heating problem will be in the summer when ambient temperatures will be much higher.Then end result is that it typically takes me just over 1 hour to mow and trim my yard---usually 50 minutes of mowing and 10 minutes of trimming and blowing.  Sometimes this takes longer and I need to wait for the first battery to charge a bit.  Maybe someone will come up with some off-brand batteries that work better.
reviews.author: MAS

reviews.title: "dont spend gour money on this"
reviews.text: I have not even had it a year and the battery charger went out so i replace it and then a few months later the battery wont take a charge it says it full but only funs a min or less iv never liked kobalts battery tools and now i really dont Now. Now i have have to buy a new battery so this thing will end up costing like $500 not worth it
reviews.author: tshewmakr

reviews.title: "Fantastic Mower"
reviews.text: I must say this mower has definitely exceeded my expectations. I was hesitant at first on purchasing an electric mower primarily because I'm used to gas mower but this one hasn't disappoint at all. The battery life is sufficient to cut my entire yard with one battery charge. I am very please with this product purchase and recommend all the gas mower enthusiast to give this electric mower a try!
reviews.author: ElectricMowerLove

reviews.title: "Regret"
reviews.text: I bought this mower mid-summer last year. The bag never attached correctly. I was willing to live with that. The battery did ok last year. It lasted long enough for me to mow my entire yard - about 5000 sf (not a big yard). I unplugged it and stored it away over the winter. Well, the battery is no longer lasting long enough to finish the yard and it's dying faster every time I use it. I'm not paying Lowes/Kobalt another 100 dollars for a piece of junk battery. Guess I'll be getting a new mower - somewhere else. Very disappointed!
reviews.author: ttodd

reviews.title: "great mower"
reviews.text: We love this mower. We've had it about a year now and can't say enough great things about it. We had an electric mower that had to be plugged in, but the cord was a hassle. We had a gas mower, but it went to crap pretty quickly, and then we decided to try the battery option with this mower. It is awesome. It is light, quiet, cuts great, etc. I haven't had any issues with any Kobalt item that i have purchased within the last few years.
reviews.author: KRay

reviews.title: "Great, if you only want to use once"
reviews.text: If you can remember what a disposable camera is, it's basically the lawn mower equivalent. This works great the first time you use it and then you throw it in the garbage. I've only had mine for 2 months and it “works” for maybe 10 minutes. I say “works” because it continuously gets jammed or stalls. Buy something, anything, else but this.
reviews.author: Dattles

reviews.title: "Dead Batteries"
reviews.text: I have the lawnmower and weed eater and I have to charge the batteries 3 times to finish my small yard. The batteries die super quick. The equipment is fine it's the batteries that are horrible.
reviews.author: Robert

reviews.title: "Fantastic equipment"
reviews.text: This product was easy to set up. Came with fully charged battery. Easy to start and use. Bought this product for my daughter and she can use it at ease. Cuts grass as good as a gas lawn mower
reviews.author: Melissa

reviews.title: "Outstanding Performance"
reviews.text: I bought this mower with some skepticism about an electric, but so far it has been a top notch piece of equipment! The battery life is estimated at 40 minutes, but depending on the length of grass and walking speed it can last much longer. I have gotten over an hour out of my battery after the first use. My yard has a pretty extreme slope in the back and on the side, but the light weight makes it easy to handle. I would absolutely recommend this mower, and look forward to getting the trimmer as well!
reviews.author: Jesse

reviews.title: "Great overall, but battery only lasts 20 minutes"
reviews.text: It's a great mower. Everything they said, but the battery will only last 18-20 minutes. So if you can't do your yard in 20 minutes, it will take almost 3 hours to charge it again.
reviews.author: Kim

reviews.title: "Awesome Mower!"
reviews.text: Best mower ever!!! Cuts like a dream! Super lightweight yet sturdy and easy to push. Love never having to worry about having enough gas or oil ever again. I can mow my entire medium sized yard and still have 2 bars of battery left. The bag is just a tad smaller than my old mower but i just use the mulching feature and dont bag it anyways. The lawn looks amazing!! I love this mower! So far so good. I have had it 2 months now. I waited to write my review after some mows. It does great in wet grass too
reviews.author: tbuckets

reviews.title: "Not as Advertised for Me"
reviews.text: I really wanted a cordless. Wanted to be more green. Did not want to deal with gas. And Lawn was too big for a corded mower. Did research and Kobalt seemed like the way to go. I have a decent yard, but it is not huge. About 4000 sq feet. According to sign the 40V Kobalt was good for 1/3 acre, which is way more than my yard. Got it home and charged the battery. First thing, not as advertised. Read it would take 30 minutes for a full charge, I am finding it takes 2-3 times as long for me. Still 60-90 minutes was ok. Started mowing on a cool day, mid 50s. Mower was quiet, light, easy to push, and did a nice job mowing. I could hear the engine rev up a little on the thicker parts of the grass (as advertised), and was happy it was doing a good job. Then after going through a little thicker area, it shut down. This is 1/3 of the way of just the smaller front yard. Tried to start again, and it would give two beeps and shut down. Took battery in and put it in charger, and a red light came up on charger, indicating battery was too hot?!. After maybe 15 minutes on a cool day? Figured it was a defective battery. Used a different battery that came with the Kobalt weed wacker and was able to finish both yards and was happy with the job. Wanted to get a new battery, but Lowes said to bring the whole mower back. Did that and got a brand new mower. Again mowing on a day in mid 60s. Grass was a little high in sections, but not over grown. Made it to the backyard this time, and it did the same thing.  Returned the mower and got a gas one. So. I WAS happy with the mower when it was working. Maybe I got unlucky and got two defective batteries. But did not want to take a chance of having this happen all the time, when the summer heat kicks in.
reviews.author: whatever

reviews.title: "Useless and inconvenient"
reviews.text: Honestly, I originally wanted to buy this mower because of the reviews and Kobalt to me has always done well. Then I went to Home Depot and looked at their Ryobi and was told by THEIR employee to go to Lower and purchase the Kobalt. I get to one lowes, they're out of stock and tell me I should buy an AWD Husquervana gas. Thankfully I didn't because it has 2 stars on their own website. Go to another lowes and at this point I've convinced myself I need to buy a gas mower. As I request the Troy Bilt, the employee plugs my ear with "HAVE YOU SEEN THE KOBALT?" So, I gave in and said why not... and this review is exactly WHY NOT. Ran the mower twice. Pros: Starts easily, looks fancy, quiet, light, easy assembly. Cons: everything about mowing the yard. Battery on run 1 lasted a total of 17 minutes. Charge time was approximately 4.5 hours to a full charge. Run 2 with a full battery was a total of 11 minutes!! I would need to have 4-5 batteries at that rate to mow my yard which is a quarter acre!! Absolutely inconvenient, and as I type my backyard has a MOHAWK to stare at. Have fun citing me on that, HOA. The good thing though, full exchange or return no questions asked aside from "what went wrong?" and I chose to bite my tongue and just utter back "the thing is crap." Bought myself a Troy-Bilt gas mower with a Honda engine for the same price aside from fuel and oil, etc. All in all, I can't wait to be environmentally unfriendly again.
reviews.author: clis

reviews.title: "Works good for my small lawn"
reviews.text: I have had this mower for a couple of months. I only have a smaller lawn. It takes about 15-20 minutes to mow. I can mow my lawn twice on a single charge without the battery going dead. I usually mow once every 7-10 day so the grass isn't ever very high so the mower usually never needs to rev up to the higher speed to power through. I like that it has the side discharge option, plus bag or mulch too. It's much quieter than a gas powered mower also. Overall, I'm glad I decided on this mower.
reviews.author: Arm1

reviews.title: "Easy to use compact storage"
reviews.text: I love this mower, it is push button start no yanking a cord, it also folds up for compact storage in my already full garage.
reviews.author: Christy

reviews.title: "Nice Mower"
reviews.text: Purchased this mower this past spring, along with the trimmer.  After a summer of use, been quite pleased with them.  Light weight, so I don't feel "beat up" after a mow as I did with a gas powered unit.  There is plenty of power to cut through long grass, although this negatively impacts battery life.  Works best when maintaining grass height.  Took a bit of getting used to swapping batteries (2.5 from the trimmer & 5.0 from mower), but on a normal trim, can get the yard done on the two.  If it's long and/or wet, trimmer for starters on the 2.5, recharge it while cutting with the 5.0, then finish off with the recharged 2.5, no down time waiting.Very quiet, so no neighbor issues mowing early in the morning.
reviews.author: bmac

reviews.title: "Great investment!"
reviews.text: Alway hated cutting yard,as a teenage. Now with my own home, invested in this cordless mover. No need for smelly gas. No straining to the pulling cord. No very loud motor. Easy to maneuver; just charge, press the button and go. Fold up & storage away easy. Now, I love to mower the lawn, without any hassle. A beautiful lawn with saving in my pocket.
reviews.author: Rebeka

reviews.title: "Perfect for me!"
reviews.text: I am a 70 year old girl who bought one for my cottage last year. My lawn is mostly hills and was worried it would be too difficult for me to push uphill. Not at all!  It is light enough for me to handle and does a great job. No problems with the battery at all. Love that it is quiet and that I don't have to use gas. I love this mower so much that I am getting one for my yard at home to do my trim work as I have a lawn tractor for major mowing. I am completely satisfied. Thanks Kobalt!
reviews.author: Cindy

reviews.title: "Kobalt 40v vs. Ryobi 40v"
reviews.text: I purchased the Kobalt 40v with the Spring sale for $240 and originally was not sure if it was a better choice than the Ryobi, so, a day later, I went and picked up the competing Ryobi mower for $250 at home depot.I'll give you a quick breakdown of the pros and cons of this mower in comparison to the Ryobi, Bottom Line Up Front: The Kobalt is a better mower.Pros: Much better build quality all around, Battery stays much cooler which is extremely important for longevity of the battery, Cuts better, Stays at 100% power much longer which helps in thicker grass, Wheels have bearings, Battery charges about an hour faster (2.5 hours vs. 3.5 hours.)Cons: It's heavier and harder to push around, battery is slightly smaller in terms of watt hours, Side extraction is much worse than mulching.Over all, I decided to keep the Kobalt, even though it's harder to push, the build quality and motor feels much better and the cut is better than the Ryobi.
reviews.author: Jason

reviews.title: "Great mower!"
reviews.text: Simple to operate yet powerful.  Made cutting my medium size yard a snap.
reviews.author: Haydeb

reviews.title: "5 Stars"
reviews.text: I had to give this 5 stars.  The instructions were clear.  I charged it over night and cut long grass and weeds.  Filled a few trash bags with the clippings.   I never had to charge before lawn was finished.  The mower is quiet so I cut it early in the morning as neighbors were going to work.  I have friends and family that asked for the details because they're looking at kobalt  electric mowers now too.  It was a great experience, user friendly,  lightweight, and extremely low to zero maintenance.  No more safety nozzles spilling gas all over the mower and garage.  No more shopping for gas, oil, and filters.  This electric mower purchase has me turning all my gas powered equipment in for kobalt electric 40 volt.  I was skeptical about 40volt versus 80volt but the price and now my experience has me satisfied with the 40volt power and reliability.  I look forward to purchasing more of this kobalt line and giving them the 5 star review they deserve.  Thank you Lowes for your kobalt product, customer service and support.
reviews.author: Stu

reviews.title: "I'll never buy a gas mower again"
reviews.text: I own 1.3 acres of land, and I mow most of it with a 54" riding mower. I use a push mower to trim around various obstacles in the yard (trees, flower beds, etc.). I have used this mower three times since buying it, and I love it. It is every bit as powerful as the 6.5 HP gas-powered Toro that I used to own, but is lighter and requires almost zero maintenance. It has the 5AH battery, and I wish it had about five minutes more charge life. The 7.5AH battery would be ideal.
reviews.author: ScottG

reviews.title: "Battery operated lawn mower."
reviews.text: Was somewhat reluctant initially since product is relatively new to market. However, since I did have a 30 day trail period I purchased the mower. It took more than the one hour as stated to charge her up but once I had it running I was pleasantly surprised at it's cutting, maneuverability and discharge into bag. My lawn is 70 X 140 and it will cut the whole lawn on one charge. I'm impressed with its overall performance. Glad I made the switch from gas. Another GREAT feature...my wife now enjoys mowing the lawn and can talk on her phone at the same time it's so quiet.
reviews.author: Mike

reviews.title: "Love this mower"
reviews.text: I wasn't going to purchase because I'm not a fan of this color blue! Very glad I did purchase it's great. Only small issue I have it when pulling back sometimes the rubber piece that hangs on the back doesn't let me pull mower back but I just push it forward a bit & 2nd try it always pulls back easily! The self propelled is great I can use it if I need or don't have to thou it would be nice if they had it covered(the pullback for self propelled)it. That does hurt my hands but that again is a small issue! No problems with battery or battery staying charged! I love it!
reviews.author: Kathy

reviews.title: "LOVE LOVE LOVE IT"
reviews.text: For starters my husband swears by Kobalt and I love cutting my 4 acres of land which hasn't been cut in over 2 weeks, I just hated my gas powered lawn mower. I was at the point of wanting to hit my lawn mower with a hammer. So I decided to go and pick this one up and give it a try. We also have a 40 vt Kobalt weed eater which is also amazing. It's so quiet. My neighbor was giving me an odd look from about 40 ft away so I asked him what's up and he said he was wondering what I was doing because he didn't hear the lawn mower at all but he was seeing the grass get shorter and shorter. Keep in mind I'm 27, a female and weigh 115 this lawn mower doesn't need to be self propel I was pushing it with one hand at some point. Its so lightweight and the fact that I can store it vertical is even better. The price is more than worth it. I highly recommend this to anyone and everyone. NOW I TOO SWEAR BY KOBALT. Heck I'm even wanting to open a grass cutting business. I love not having to smell the fumes anymore or have to deal with the constant cranking. I was able to cut a few feet short of 2 acres before the battery finally died. Just make sure you don't over charge it or leave it dead too long is the best recommendation with any battery powered tools.
reviews.author: LeeAnn

reviews.title: "Wishing I still had my gas mower"
reviews.text: I got this mower through the lawnmower exchange program. My first impression upon using it the first time is one of deep regret. My old gas mower that I gave up is looking really good right now. My yard is not huge...only .2 acres. Yet, the battery is on the charger for the 4th time and the yard is not even done yet. The battery does not last 40 minutes. Also, before you can even charge the battery you have to let the stupid battery cool down for 30 minutes before you can even put the darn thing on the charger. The one redeeming quality it has is that it is quiet. From inside the house you can't even tell it is running. Unfortunately, that one redeeming quality is not enough to redeem the quality of the crappy battery.
reviews.author: Anonymous

reviews.title: "Worked great on my first use"
reviews.text: After spending a couple of hours trying to get my old gas mover to start, I took the plunge and bought a new Kobalt 40-volt cordless mower.  Spring is here and my grass is only getting longer.  I read many of the reviews, both good and bad, so I was optimistic, but also apprehensive, that it could do the job on my lawn.  I have about 8,000 square feet of lawn, some of it on a steep slope, with many turns and tight places.  In the Pacific Northwest where I live, April to June means a lot of mowing and the grass can be thick and wet.  The Kobalt 40-volt was easy to assemble.  It took two hours for the battery to charge.  Because my grass was tall, and it had rained the day before, I set it up as side discharge.  It had no problem mowing for more than an hour and around 6,000 square feet of lawn, or 3/4 of my yard, on one charge.  Less than 10% of the time did it kick into high power mode.  It's lighter than my old gas mower, easy to maneuver, cuts smoothly and is nice and quiet.  No ear protection required. So far I'm very happy with the Kobalt 40-volt.  No pull start.  Light.  Quiet.  No oil or gas.  It remains to be seen how it will hold up over time, and I'm a little concerned that the 5.0 amp hour replacement battery is currently unavailable,  but based on my first use, I give it 5 stars.  I will submit a follow up review in November after a season of use.
reviews.author: Peter

reviews.title: "Not a bad lawnmower"
reviews.text: Not a bad lawnmower. It cuts well and it is nice to not pull-start your mower. The down side is the battery life. I have a small lawn and can't cut it on one charge. I am looking at getting the trimmer too more for a second battery than a real need of the trimmer, but with only three small things to trim around I should be able to finish my lawn in one shot.
reviews.author: MarkC

reviews.title: "Worthless Trash"
reviews.text: I have a small yard and when I bought this mower about 10 months ago, I was hoping I could avoid buying a gas-powered mower. This this work ok for about 10 months, then just stopped working one day for no reason. Battery was charged. Blade was clear. It simply would not start. I've learned my lesson, and I will not buy another Kobalt product ever again.
reviews.author: Justin

reviews.title: "Waste of time and money"
reviews.text: This mower mowed my very small yard twice and then the battery life went to less than 5 minutes. Takes 3 to 4 hours to charge for 5 minutes of mowing. Even when it's mowing it's more of a trimmer. Bogs easily. I received no help from Lowe's and Kobalt is closed for the 3 day weekend. After many years of Lowe's I am done, I will no longer shop there.
reviews.author: Dave

reviews.title: "Starting out with 5 stars"
reviews.text: I bought this earlier today for 249.00, the display said 299.00, but they gave it to me for th add price if 249.00. Easy to put together , all you need to do is attach the handle , put on the grass disperser and decide if you want to bag or mulch. I put the battery in the charger right away and it flashed green for about two hours and I pulled it and plugged it into the mower. There i is a yellow key near the battery, someone else said you have to remove the key to run it. No, that's backwards, you leave the key in to the run it. I would say I have an average sized yard and it cut my grass no problem with the one battery. I did have some issues with the check battery status button on th battery , it only worked after I was done and I had one bar left. This mower is plenty powerful to cut thick grass, 6-8 inches high. It does not bog down , but increases power as needed . It's pretty cool it Revs up and down when needed and you don't need to hesitate when cutting. Chomps right trough !! 5 stars to the Lowe's employee that helped me at the new mount pleasant, sc store. He actually helped me with two things!!
reviews.author: John

reviews.title: "Very impressed"
reviews.text: We got this thing on the exchange program and I was skeptical but after the first use, I would buy this for sure.power was great cuts perfectly and fills the entire bag unlike my gas powered craftsman . One battery lasted the entire yard which is a 1/4 acre lot.
reviews.author: Brian

reviews.title: "Battery could be better."
reviews.text: Using a battery powered lawn mower for the first time. Used with mulching attachment and the mower is awesome! Except, the battery had to be charged after mowing 3/4th of my lawn. My entire lot is 0.2 acres and I hoped to mow the entire lawn without recharging.
reviews.author: YawnMower

reviews.title: "Easy Cut"
reviews.text: I have a small yard so this lawn mower is perfect for me. I get two cuts on a charge and don't have to deal with gas and oil or using an extension cord. Handle installation was easy, no tools required. I don't use the grass catcher but it comes with the mower.
reviews.author: Phil

reviews.title: "Easy Mowing for a none-mower"
reviews.text: My husband is currently deployed and my whole 29 years of my life I never done lawn work and not looking forwarded to the struggle but to my surprise this lawn mower made it soo easy. And thank goodness. I actually haven't mind going outside to do lawn work.
reviews.author: Nicole

reviews.title: "Great Mower"
reviews.text: I was a little skeptical at first getting a battery powered mower. I thought it over and since I already have a 40 Volt trimmer and the reviews here were mostly favorable I decide to give it a try. Kobalt already has a reputation for quality products so I knew the chances were slim I would be disappointed. The mower comes pretty much already assembled. I only had to assemble the handle and then charge the battery. The first thing I noticed was how quiet this is compared to a gas powered mower. While cutting I noticed that the torque on the mower would increase in thicker grass. It can sense how thick the grass is and adjusts accordingly. My yard is not very big so this was perfect. I used the mulching feature and the mower did a FANTASTIC job. I would highly recommend if you have a small yard and are tired of the gas and oil purchases.
reviews.author: KC

reviews.title: "Costly mistake"
reviews.text: The lawn mower cost $300.00 and the mower works great. The problem is the power supply (batteries) the five amh battery last about 30 minutes the first year of ownership then deteriorated from there. I bought a second battery which was a 2 amh battery that cost $100.00. Two years later both batteries will not fully charge (two power bars out of four) and frequently ends with a red light on the charger. Can't afford the power source and with out a reliable power source the mower is useless. I have gone back to a reliable gas mower which uses less than a quart of gas to mow a half acre lot which calculates to $18.00 in gas a season. It will take 5 to 6 years of mowing with gas to equal just one 2 amh battery. I would highly not recommend this mower, I had to replace it with a reliable gas mower.
reviews.author: Bill

reviews.title: "Love it"
reviews.text: I love this lawnmower. It is quiet and light. It's so easy start and it cuts well.  We live on less than a quartet acre and it is able to cut on one charge if the grass is not to long. The first time I cut it I hadn't cut the grass in about 3 weeks so it died about 3/4 of the way through. It takes about 2 hours to fully charge the battery so if you don't get it all in one shot you may not get it all on the same day. I'm not always able to start charging immediately because the battery won't charge when hot.  All in all I prefer this lawnmower over a gas mower.
reviews.author: James

reviews.title: "Pleasantly surprised"
reviews.text: Coming from a gas mower, I wasn't sure what to expect with an electric. This is great. It has plenty of power, little to no vibration, and it is very light. It sounds pretty cool too. I am very happy with the purchase and would recommend to anyone.
reviews.author: Rick

reviews.title: "Great power and very easy to use"
reviews.text: Since I have a lot of back pain and other health issues I bought this battery operated lawn mower as it is easier to push around my lot, and a nice bonus is that it is so much quieter than the gas powered mowers.  Love that part too!!
reviews.author: Lrr

reviews.title: "perfect for my needs"
reviews.text: we purchased this during the spring black Friday sale. I was tired of gas mowers with the smell and cost of gas. this guy came out together and folded in the box with a 5v battery and charger. I immediately used the mower to reset the battery and drain it on my front lawn. this guy is pretty neat! it cut really well and the height settings were easy to use. I like the feature that it turns off when you release the lever and it's easy to push.
reviews.author: noirinertia

reviews.title: "Cordless Electric Mower"
reviews.text: Bought the mower a year ago and it worked really well until the battery wouldn't charge anymore.  Tried to find a replacement 5.0 amp battery but apparently they don't sell them.  The mower comes with a 5.0 amp battery so that doesn't make any sense. Had to buy the 2.5 amp battery and it doesn't last through mowing my entire lawn like the 5.0 amp battery did.  Also it bogs down and I have to go over the tall grass more than once with the 2.5 amp battery.  The mower doesn't run fast enough to mow the tall grass well.  I'm going back to the regular gas mower.
reviews.author: Actar70

reviews.title: "Item not as advertised"
reviews.text: "Kobalt 40-volt cordless mower provides the power you need for up to 40 minutes runtime on a fully charged 5.0 Ah battery"This is the first bullet point in the description.  I've had my mower for less than 6 months.  It was purchased with a blower, weed trimmer, and hedge trimmer, with a total of 3 batteries.  I logged on today to look into purchasing additional batteries because 3 aren't enough for our medium yard.  One battery lasts 10-15 minutes.  The first line describes a 5.0 Ah battery.  I checked all 3 of mine and that is not what I received.  All 3 are 5.0 Ah, which may be what is advertised as included with the other tools, but where is the 5.0?  All in all, this is the worst purchase I have made.  I'll probably have to start over next year.
reviews.author: jlb

reviews.title: "Unreliable"
reviews.text: It started great, but things went south I just a few months. By the end of the season, the battery didn't hold a charge and if the grass was even a little thick or long, it quit. On top of that, because it works harder, the battery life is shorter.Maybe one day we'll have reliable electric mowers, but this isn't it.
reviews.author: Matt

reviews.text: Only complaint is the battery only lasts about 20 minutes per charge, so a lot of interruptions to recharge.
reviews.author: Tim

reviews.title: "Know what you are buying first!"
reviews.text: Bought this a couple of days ago. On dry grass that's a few inches high, expect 20 minutes out of the battery. I expected this as run times are always exaggerated on manufacturer claims. That's ok because 20 minutes in the hot sun at a time is about all I want to do anyway, so built in breaks. Recharging takes a few hours and currently you can't find any extra 5ah batteries to purchase anywhere. It would be nice to have a spare battery,but like I said, this works fine for my needs. If you try to mow wet grass, expect about 10 minutes run time (because it's working hatder) and stopping frequently to unclog the chute. Those critiques aside, not dealing with gas, oil and air filters more than makes up for the shortcomings and if you really need more run time, spend a bit more and get the 80v mower. It's also really easy to store vertically and clean in this pisition. Just pull out the battery and safety key and scoop out the stuck grass before putting away. Lowes, you really need to get more of these batteries in stock. I'm probably going to want to buy a spare next season.
reviews.author: DandyDJ

reviews.title: "Good lawn mower for the money"
reviews.text: I had a first generation Kobalt 40V lawn mower, however it started having issues so I got it replaced with this newer generation and Kobalt has improved on it in a few key areas.  First off the standing up vertical was a nice touch, but really the biggest change I appreciated was the knobs/screws to fold the handle over was much better design.  Overall for the money I'd recommend this mower for small yards, anything bigger go for 80V.
reviews.author: Steven

reviews.title: "Good mower."
reviews.text: Very happy with this mower. It handles my half acre easily. It is much quieter than a gas mower and incredibly light. I was looking to get a self propelled model but I didn't need it after all. The light weight makes it very maneuverable.  Easy adjustments for a custom fit and custom cut. The battery lasts about an hour and the charge is fairly quick. So far, it has been a good choice. No oil, gas, plug, of exhaust. Less fuss, same cut
reviews.author: Mark

reviews.title: "Batteries"
reviews.text: Just got the mower which works well but it seems the battery does not last as long as advertised by a significant amount.  It also seems that no one has the 5ah battery in Canada?   Is this an obsolete product?
reviews.author: spavio

reviews.title: "Battery fails in under two years, choose a differe"
reviews.text: The weak part of the product is the battery.  I purchased in July of 2016, 22 months ago.  The battery life is now less than half of what it was at first.  I tried to call the lowes support line to see what they would do, they said the support line closes at 8, it is currently 7:50 but they are closed.  I guess just like the battery they close up a bit early.
reviews.author: dissatisfied

reviews.title: "Future of Lawn Care"
reviews.text: I have been mowing for 30 years. This is the best mower I have ever used. It is so quiet and powerful. I would suggest it to anyone!!! Get a couple solar panels too. Keep rockin it Kobalt!!!
reviews.author: Tony

reviews.title: "Surprised and happy"
reviews.text: My first electric mower purchase. It was able to mow the front and back lawn on one charge. It is quiet compared to a gas mower. No more dealing with gas or oil. Cuts nicely. Handle material feels cheap though, foam padding. Only downside it does not create as much wind. Leaves stuck below gas are less likely to be mulched and you can not use mower to blow clipping on sidewalk. Overall, pleased in not having to pull a cord.
reviews.author: Kgordish

reviews.title: "Awesome!"
reviews.text: This thing is awesome, plain an simple.I never thought I would ever purchase an electric lawn mower but I am happy that I did.Mows grass amazingly.So quiet you can mow grass and talk on the phone.Never have to go buy fuel when I forget that the tank is empty again.No cleaning the carb , or mess with fuel treatment products again.Never have to yank on the pull string 300 times to start.Would HIGHLY RECOMMEND.
reviews.author: BlueGill

reviews.title: "Easy to use, cuts great, batt life could be better"
reviews.text: I first purchase online to pickup in store. Picked it up, got home battery said it had about 50 percent life. So thought I would try it out see how far I could get. It kept shutting off every few minutes. I assumed it maybe just needed to charge fully the first time. Tried next day showed fully charged but did the same thing. Called Kobalt support very helpful stated it was probably battery and they could send another one 5-7 days or I could take back to lowes and replace whole thing. Did that and charged fully and works so far so good. It cuts pretty good, does get bogged down a little in thicker stuff but to be expected. I have a typical subdivision house and yard and can get through 75% of front and back if normal height. I wish the battery lasted a little longer, but still pleased and with back problems it's a godsend. It's so light, no pulling to start, and magic!!
reviews.author: Richie

reviews.title: "Electric mower review"
reviews.text: I have this mower because my previous mower died.  I owned the kobalt mower with two battles and two small motors and blades.  It came with a 4amp and 2 amp batteries.  When one battery depleated the second one took over.  I was able to cut my whole yard with this system.  When I got this mower it came with a 5amp battery with a single brushless motor.  I thought with the upgraded motor and larger battery I would be able to cut the same amount of lawn.  Wrong.  Battery runs out of juice about 15 minutes before I am done.  Luckily I have another battery so I can complete the job.  This mower should have come with an additional battery to increase run time.  The mower is good but this is my major disappointment.  If I'd didn't have another battery I would have to purchase another one.
reviews.author: David

reviews.title: "Not a Good Product"
reviews.text: A fully charged batter quits on me after one hour, so I recharge it only to have it conk out on me after less than ten minutes of mowing. Lowe's was nice and exchanged it for another Kobalt, and the same thing happened. This mower is a complete waste of money.
reviews.author: Mike

reviews.title: "Love this mower"
reviews.text: I love the Kobalt 40-volt brushless lithium ion 20 inch cordless electric lawn mower. It is perfect for my back yard and super easy to use. A push of a button and off you go. The battery lasted long enough to mow my back yard and was still going strong. Plenty of height settings to choose from and folds down for storage. I highly recommend this mower to anyone that doesn't want the hassles of a gas push mower.
reviews.author: Argo777777

reviews.title: "fantastic mower"
reviews.text: I replaced a Craftsman 40volt mower with this one. It's amazing how much technology has improved in cordless mowers. This mower can handle my entire property on 25% of full charge. my old mower took 2 batteries. My only gripe is this mower is very heavy. however it mulches better than any mower I have ever had, gas or electric. If you follow good care practices for the lithium battery this mower is fantastic.
reviews.author: Zane

reviews.title: "Kobalt cordless lawnmower"
reviews.text: Kobalt 20inch ,sturdier, metal frame. The previous 18in Black and Decker plastic frame that flexes easily, cordless mower, batteries were not replaceable,3 hour charge. My 2500sq.ft.yard normally one battery. If grass longer than normal the second battery is used for 5-10 minutes more. For picking up leaves I need second battery. Side chute spreads grass further aiming clippings nutrients at lawns weakspots
reviews.author: Paul

reviews.title: "Kobalt battery mower"
reviews.text: This is a lightweight, easy to start mower that is powerful and quiet. The bagger is super easy to use and convenient.  Then when done with mowing storing this takes little space. It can eeen hang on a wall for the off season. I purchased the mower one month ago and would recommend this product. I also have the Kobalt weed eater and hedge trimmer for over a year and these are outstanding products as well.
reviews.author: Krissysc

reviews.title: "Perfect Mower...Almost"
reviews.text: We bought the 40V mower. I absolutely love everything about it. There is serious power behind it and it does a fantastic job on our yard. I wish the battery was a little bigger just for my own sanity but it cuts the back and front without issues. We have about a 3000ft square yard. Great mower great price and i save the world. What can go wrong?
reviews.author: jon

reviews.title: "Better than the Ryobi 40V Brushless"
reviews.text: I bought the Ryobi 40V brushless and used it for 5 mows.  Not bad, not great for sure.  It is too light for me and the quality of the cut was not nice and neat.  It was clear that the mower blade speed is not fast enough to cut in one pass in some instances.  The main thing I did not like is how plastic it is.  Some may see this as a benefit as to durability, no rust, lightness etc.  I then bought the Kobalt 40V brushless, push mower.  I love it.  In comparison it is way more sturdy, has more weight and that makes a difference in not bouncing around on the ground as you push it.  The cut quality was better than the Ryobi.  Clearly cutting the grass in comparison to the Ryobi.So far just a few days, but I like it.  I opted for the 40V versus the 80v for price, and the fact my lawn is not that large.  I did consider the EGO but would instead go to 80V if I go up to more power at this time.  Next year I suspect we'll see a 100V model by some maker.  For our lawn size 40V seems right.Battery mowers like this will have limitations.  Don't bad mouth the product simply because you cannot mow a larger lot or it does not pick up leaves.  For small yards this is a great mower.
reviews.author: joq1

reviews.title: "great mower"
reviews.text: my old gas mower gave up after 6 years so I needed to get a new one and had been researching the battery mowers. I have your average size lot and I was able to cut the complete yard on a single charge. The height control is done with one lever and the bag is easy on & Off. Glad I was able to get this one. I do miss the self propelled of the old one but at 65 years old I need to work out a little more.
reviews.author: Tony

reviews.title: "Works Great"
reviews.text: I have had a Ryobi battery lawnmower and the battery went dead within 2 years, bought another battery then the mower started shutting down after 5 minutes, I looked at several brands before buying the Kobalt mower, I am very pleased with it so far one charge and I can cut my entire lawn and bag it. With all the rain we have been getting this summer the grass is very tall and it powers right through it.
reviews.author: LD

reviews.title: "Excellent Mower"
reviews.text: Light and quiet. The charge easily did my 1/3 acre lot and it folds up for easy storage
reviews.author: Lawnman

reviews.title: "Love this mower!"
reviews.text: I bought this mower about a month ago and have only used it twice, but so far am very happy with it. I am an older woman and was very tired of fooling with gas and tugging and tugging on a gas powered mower.this was so easy to assemble and starts with the push of a button.love that!.works great and one charge mows my entire yard,which is not huge,but is a reasonable size. Would recommend for sure.
reviews.author: Eabarth

reviews.title: "Electric and Convenient"
reviews.text: By far the best mess free easy to put away and take out lawn mower we've had!
reviews.author: Samantha

reviews.title: "My First Lithium Ion lawn mower"
reviews.text: This is a replacement for my Worx WG780. after replacing my acid cell lawn mover battery twice at $200 a pop, it was time for Lithium. Just use it for one day. CUT both back and front lawns with two bars left. Why do I love it also.....The battery is LIGHt!! No more acid worx bar bells. But how do I register it? Do I call in or what. What if I need a replacement part or repair. Please tell me
reviews.author: sandman

reviews.title: "Extremely dissatisfied with this mower"
reviews.text: I wanted to like this mower. I have the kobalt electric cordless trimmer and it works great. I honestly can not say that about this mower. All the great reviews about it said it could now about a quarter of an acre with no problem. This is not even slightly true. Or may be true if you barely have anything to mow. If the mower has anything thick to cut through or your grass is slightly even damp, you will have to restart about 50 times due to clogging and then your battery will run out due to overheating. This mower is not a great purchase.
reviews.author: Mike

reviews.title: "good mower"
reviews.text: this mower worked very well my yard was a little too big for it and I had to get the 80v version as i already had a spare battery (and the 80v take 30m to charge instead of 150m) but if your yard is .2 acres or less this will work for you it didnt even have any issues with thick tall or wet grass it just kicks into high gear and keeps on chugging and the 3 in 1 option makes it very versatile
reviews.author: Erik

reviews.title: "Good mower, bad battery"
reviews.text: The mower has worked fine, but 3 months in the battery quit charging. I contacted Kobalt since the battery should have a 3 year warranty. They said they would replace it but a month later I still do not have a battery. I have contacted them and they say they shipped it but I still do not have it. Just want to mow my lawn. Also Kobalt customer service department could be a lot more friendly.
reviews.author: Cyriana

reviews.title: "The best mower"
reviews.text: I bought this to replace a 8 year old Black & Decker 18 v. mower. I thought the B&D was good but this Kobalt runs rings around it. I mow 1/2 acre plus and have 2 bars left (out of 4). Full charge after 2 1/2 hours (compared to the B&D of 1 day plus). The only complaint is that the charging station is finicky - make sure the battery is firmly seated and double check it after a few minutes.
reviews.author: rlg0613

reviews.title: "Buy extra batteries for more than 1/2 acre"
reviews.text: This is my first mower. I have had disc surgery and wanted something light weight. This mower is definitely light. And it's so quiet! My property is about three quarter acres so I bought a second battery. I can do the back yard on two batteries and the front yard on one. There are double battery mowers for anything larger. It mulches very nicely and the safety features are a must with small children in the house. I like the idea of one type of battery for all the tools. Great mower, very recommended. And also, please make a small tiller.
reviews.author: Geoff

reviews.title: "5 stars but with a big IF"
reviews.text: Yes this mower will surprise and amaze you. It's just as good or even better than advertised IF you have a small yard and keep up on it. Best mulching mower I've ever used. However, anything much over a half hour you will be running the risk of the battery dying. 40 minutes max if you're lucky. You also need to be someone that keeps up good with the mowing. It's not that this mower won't power through tall wet grass because it will. The problem is the toll it takes on the battery. Can cut the battery life in half! This may also cause the battery to overheat which can take up to an hour to cool down enough to charge! The battery can then take over 3 hours to charge! Starting and stopping a bunch can also cut down some on battery life. So if you have a small well maintained yard then you will absolutely love this mower. Quiet and lightweight like many have mentioned. No need for self propelled for most.
reviews.author: Dan

reviews.title: "Battery is only good for one year"
reviews.text: I bought this mower last spring and it was great. I have a very small .20 acre lot and last summer I could easily cut the front and back on one battery charge. This year I have cut the lawn about 4 times and the battery won't even get through the back yard before I have to recharge it. So now it takes me 4 days to cut the front and back. This thing is garbage. Get something else.
reviews.author: Joe

reviews.title: "excellent product, switched from gas to cordless"
reviews.text: Bough it at the store after reading many reviews and watching many videos. the size of my yards is not huge but a good size. Out of the box the battery was half way, left it charging overnight and the next day I did my lawn. I was pleasantly surprised on the performance of the mower, i was able to do the whole yard and the battery showed 2 blocks left. It usually takes me about an hour to do my whole yard, trimming edges and cutting lawn.i must say that i have the kobalt weed trimmer and that battery doesn't hold for my whole yard, so i even used the battery from the mower to finish the job.after, doing the yard, i cleaned the mower and put aside in a corner of my garage, storage space is a big deal for me, since i use the garage as a home gym and been able to fold it and vertically store the unit is a great feature. no more gas or oil smells.i will definitely purchase more cordless kobalt products.
reviews.author: kobaltsatisfied

reviews.title: "So-So"
reviews.text: Had this for a little less than a year.  Mower works okay as long as you don't want to cut your lawn short.  Then it will CONSTANTLY jam up and stop.  Battery power is only adequate and runs out very quickly in the hot summer sun and is unable to charge until it cools down.  I mentioned that to one of the reps at Lowe's.  He suggested not mowing when the sun was up (guess I missed the option of a front headlight), not cutting the grass short, or (the best one yet) put the batteries in the freezer to cool down faster before charging!
reviews.author: Robert

reviews.title: "Much better than expected"
reviews.text: I debated between the 40V and 80V battery for a while.  I also couldn't choose between self-propelled or not.  I am so glad that I chose this model - the battery is sufficient and it is light enough that I don't need self-propelled.  I also bought the hedge-trimmer and it works great.  It is nice that the batteries are interchangeable.  Very pleased with the purchases!
reviews.author: Dingomama

reviews.title: "Weak Batteries"
reviews.text: Battery would only mow about 1/4 of my city lot before it was dead.  Returned and got the Greenworks 21" for the same money.  Much better mower for the money.
reviews.author: Jack

reviews.title: "Perfect for small yard"
reviews.text: Purchased this mower, the 40v line trimmer and 40v blower — the mower and blower are perfect for my yard.  Not happy with the design of the line trimmer (and the recharger was defective so I returned it hassle-free).  One battery charge was enough for all mowing, trimming and blowing.  I like the way this mower easily folds up for storage in my small garage, too.
reviews.author: Scott

reviews.title: "Commercial landscaper's review."
reviews.text: Have owned a commercial landscaping company for 9 years. This mower for a homeowner is fantastic if you have a small well maintained yard. It's quiet
reviews.author: Dan

reviews.title: "Keep looking. Your money is best spent elsewhere"
reviews.text: I purchased the mower 3/30/19. It was missing the handle bolts (322041179) and handle knobs (322041179). I returned it the next day, but it was still missing the same parts. So I called the company. They sent me the correct bolts, but the incorrect locking nuts. I called them again. They finally sent the right handle knob, but only 1 of them. The mower requires 2. Regardless of sending me the right parts, the battery lasts 20 minutes. And takes 3 hours to charge. Your money is best spend elsewhere.
reviews.author: John

reviews.title: "Replaced older 2-blade 40V"
reviews.text: After 4 years of relatively hard use (lot is 0.47 acres), our older model 2-blade 20in mower kicked the bucket.  With it still being inside the 5-year warranty, they were happy to refund the original purchase price since it wasn't made anymore, and replace with this one.  Since 80V is a thing now, the 40V is quite a bit cheaper than the original, and at first I wasn't thrilled about not having the 2 battery slots.  However, I'm pleasantly surprised by the increased run capacity with the brushless motor.  I still miss the better mulching of the twin-blade design, but this thing hogs through thick grass almost as well as any gas motor.  Once the lawn was back to normal length, regular mowing is just as easy before, with easy start up and nearly zero maintenance.  Definitely recommend to anyone who has trouble starting a gas motor or just wants something that is very easy to keep running and a heck of a lot lighter than an engine.
reviews.author: GR

reviews.title: "Not Worth It!"
reviews.text: Sounded like a pretty good buy when I purchased this AND the weed eater 2 weeks ago.. I can't get this thing to last 20 minutes. Which is about half of what they advertise it will last for. I'd be interested to know how they came up with "40 Minutes of run time". If you are actually mowing and using the self-propel function it only last 20 to 30 minutes TOPS. I'm not mowing a field or anything crazy. I'm on .17 of an acre and its all flat. For this thing to stop 3/4's of the way through makes me wish I would have stuck with gas.
reviews.author: Kevin

reviews.title: "Decent Mower, Batteries are terrible"
reviews.text: I bought this mower in April 2019, and it's a major inconvenience. It's my first battery-powered mower, and I had no idea how frustrating these devices were. I have just under 1/4 acre yard and it takes three charges to get through it (mowed 4 times so far). I've tried everything imaginable to get the battery to last longer, (following advice given on other complaints regarding battery life) but it's apparently just the inadequacy of these batteries. The cut is consistent and clean, when you have battery life...just don't expect to cut very long before you have stop for 5 hours to recharge the battery. If this is the future of “clean” yard products, it leaves a lot to be desired. I think I'm just really disappointed. I had such hopes for this quiet machine. I'm now left wondering if I should go buy a 2nd battery to get through my tiny yard, or if I should just cut my losses and buy another gas-powered machine. Are there any suggestions I could try to prolong the battery life? I want to like this mower, but with the 30 to 45-minute battery life, it's not meeting my needs. I bought this based on the cut times provided by the company and reviewers on the website and on the box. I simply have been unable to come close to the times advertised on the website. I'm not sure if I would re-purchase this mower knowing how short the mow times are with this battery.
reviews.author: DurhamDad

reviews.title: "The battery is a real let down"
reviews.text: I love that this mower is clean, quiet, push start. I don't even mind it not being self propelled. What I do mind is he battery. The first use I was able to cut half my yard, charge for an hour and then finish the rest. Five or six uses in, it takes me two days. Four battery charges. And now the charging takes more than 2 hours. Don't waste your money.
reviews.author: Jennifer

reviews.title: "40 v push mower"
reviews.text: This a great product.  It is quiet, very simple to use and no more cords to get in the way.  I used to a Kobalt electric mower which had to be plugged in and was very inconvenient with a cord in the way all the time. I have a small yard and this mower is perfect for me.  I've gotten several uses out of one full charged battery.  Very convenient.
reviews.author: Nancy

reviews.title: "A must have for home"
reviews.text: Im a first time home owner and lawn mower , i must tell you im impressed with  the Performance of the Kobalt cordless lawn mower.Why would anyone  want a gas mower ?The 5ah battery last a long time My reasoning is if they can make an high performance battery operating car why wouldn't a battery operating lawn mower perform well. Love it !!
reviews.author: Bigbiglou

reviews.title: "For the world's smallest yard"
reviews.text: This thing would be great if I had a yard 1/4 the size of my current yard cause that's how length battery lasts. I can do my front yard then charge. My side yard then charge. Half my back yard then charge. Then the other half. It takes way to long to do this it's ridiculous. I just want my grass cut dang it.
reviews.author: Joey

reviews.title: "Lemon"
reviews.text: battery and power of this mower is not even worth the car trip from the store to your home.
reviews.author: jfk

reviews.title: "Excellent Lawn Mowing Package"
reviews.text: I was hesitant to enter the cordless lawn mower market because of the myriad of products offered and the crazy way batteries are rated and reviewed.  I did some research and decided that the no gas, oil and engine maintenance is where I wanted to be.  I have a lawn under 1000 sq. ft. in the front and about 2500 sq. ft. in the back.  So far only the front is needing mowed.  There is no grade, bumps or hills in the lawn.  The mower has worked perfectly with all of the attachments and the battery has been fantastic.  Blade is sharp and provides a clean even cut.  I mowed the front lawn twice and put the battery back in the charger and it was still almost fully charged.  Much quieter than other mowers and you can store it upright because there is no loss of gas or oil.  Craftmanship is excellent and the price point was right in line.    Quite happy with this purchase.  My better half thinks the blue looks cool and that's why I let her mow the lawn now.
reviews.author: Zeke

reviews.title: "Battery Doesn't Last"
reviews.text: The mower itself is pretty decent. It's quiet and easy to use but doesn't plow through tall grass very well so be prepared to make a second pass over your lawn. The batteries that came with our mower worked fine for a few seasons (from 2015 to 2018) but this year, within months of each other, we had three dead batteries (one was from our Kobalt trimmer). Kobalt will not replace the batteries since they are no longer under warranty--which is understandable. What isn't understandable is that to replace all three batteries would cost nearly $300. I could buy a brand new gas mower for that! Spending $300 to replace batteries every few years is ridiculous and to that end, they are also difficult to find. In my store, they only carried a 2.5ah battery (cost me $80) and it took three charges and several hours to cut my lawn. I would never recommend purchasing one of these mowers!
reviews.author: AndreaC

reviews.title: "Great mower for the right task"
reviews.text: This mower was easy to assemble, it was ready to cut as soon as the battery charged up. It looks cool and holds its own for mowing. For smaller yards this is the way to go. No fuel, no cords , just easy mowing. You can stop and start it multiple times to move items for example without having to pull a cord to restart. It really is light enough to push up hills with ease. The charging lights on the charger are easy to understand and the battery has a built in guage. This guage is my favorite, taking out the guess work of how much a battery is charged. It has a nice bagger also. The one level height adjustment is neat for matching various mowing conditions.
