Mowing time is as reported and can be longer if you take breaks. Nifty and care free mowing-almost. It can be tempting to forget that you are using a mower since this is so quiet. The same safety practices should be used with this one and gas mowers regarding foot placement and projectile protection.
reviews.author: Russell

reviews.title: "Perfect for Seniors and small yards!"
reviews.text: Needed a lawn mower that I could handle easily! No pulling or heavy lifting. Easy push button start, easy to adjust the height with one touch, cut was great, easy on and off grass catcher, not to heavy. Easy fold up to put away!! Would have liked two batteries so I could have gotten the front and back done! Overall I am very happy!
reviews.author: Griff

reviews.title: "Battery and charger stopped working in a 2 years"
reviews.text: The battery stopped  working within a year and half. We got a replacement Kobalt battery. Now the second battery and the charger both don't work. The cost of the two batteries and the charger is almost as much as buying a new mower. I've had other equipment from different brands, and those batteries work fine even after 5 years.
reviews.author: UnsatisfiedCustomer

reviews.title: "Nice, light mower with plenty of charge"
reviews.text: We needed a new mower and noticed the prices on the battery-powered ones now match that of gas powered (used to be $500~800). We were going to get another Kobalt that was the same price on sale with two batteries, but saw that one has a 4 Ah and a 2 Ah. This one has one 5 Ah battery. I was able to mow ~20,000 sf with still enough charge left over. Pros:Lightweight. No need for a self-propelled feature on this. It's light and easy to push, which I really like, since most self-propelled mowers are hideously slow. Plenty of power. I'm able to do the whole lawn on one charge. It takes about 2.5 hours to fully charge, which isn't a problem. Hopefully the battery capacity doesn't degrade over time. Large wheels. The 8" rear wheel and larger front makes traversing uneven terrain easier. Vertical storage. It stands up on its own and can be stored away easily. Not having to store gas and oil is also a huge plus.Quiet. It seems to have a low and high speed that automatically adjusts, starting slow after starting, then going fast after a while. Either speed is like a big fan. Cons:No major cons so far, but my only complaint is the smooth plastic housing which easily attracts dust and gets dirty very quickly. This shouldn't be a problem in the summer months cutting wetter grass. I just wipe it down with a damp cloth and store it, though. Battery-powered appliances have advanced quite a bit recently. If you are on the fence as whether to go gas or electric, give this one a try. With the long warranty, it should last a long time. If the battery starts to go out after five years, a new one is about $150, which is probably about what you would spend on gas, oil, spark plugs and filters on a gas mower in that time.
reviews.author: PM-TX

reviews.title: "does everything i need it to do"
reviews.text: so far, this lawnmower has done everything i needed it to do. because my backyard was way overgrown, it took a couple of charges in order to mow it completely. now that i'm in maintenance mode for the yard, i can cut both front and back yard on one charge. i look forward to adding more dewalt electric tools to my collection.
reviews.author: dan

reviews.title: "Low power, bad battery"
reviews.text: I bought it 2 months ago for my my 0.3 acres piece of land. Have no complaints about quality of lawn mover, but the battery...Actually only the half of my loan needs to move lawn, the rest are a house and garden. The fully charged battery works 20 min max, so I can cut the grass only in a small piece of land. I need to charge my battery 3-4 times to cut the grass on 0.15 acres. It is awful, I expected much more for the price. Very disappointed. Had to buy gas lawn mover, not this one!!
reviews.author: Inesa

reviews.title: "Perfect for My Average Sized Yard"
reviews.text: I have a fairly typical suburban piece of property with a small lawn in front and a larger lawn behind/beside the house. This mower attacks it with power and ease, whether mulching or bagging. No issues at all with battery life--I'm able to complete the entirety of mowing on one charge with plenty of battery left.
reviews.author: Tombo

reviews.title: "Excellent lawn mower for my .25 quarter acre lawn"
reviews.text: This is a great mower, easy to put together, easy to use, not hard to handle and can manage any amount of grass it encounters. I really love this mower and would highly recommend it to any one. The battery lasts really long and is easy to charge. Also if you are a lady needing a mower this is one you should buy.
reviews.author: Ladyinlevis

reviews.title: "Great at first"
reviews.text: I bought this mower in May.  It worked really well at first.  At this point, I can mow less than half of my (smaller than) quarter acre yard before the battery dies. Half the time, the grass doesn't get pushed all the way into the bag, leaving clippings everywhere.  It would probably work for a very small yard.
reviews.author: Deb

reviews.title: "Great product"
reviews.text: Easy to assemble. Very quiet. Even cut. Mowed my mid size lawn and had enough battery power left to mow the lawn a second time. This was my first time using the mower and I was extremely impressed. I don't think I'll ever go back to a gas or electric mower ever again. This mower is great and I recommend it!!
reviews.author: Mike

reviews.title: "Powerfull"
reviews.text: I just got that Lawnmower and I love it , its easy to but together an after charging the Battery I was ready to go, never did my own lawn ,my Lawn was overgrown  and that Little Mover  was cutting the grass like butter , I'm happy with my Mower , would buy it again...Thank you Lowes for a great value
reviews.author: Mandy

reviews.title: "Very Impressed So Far So Good!"
reviews.text: I reviewed multiple cordless mowers before finally choosing the 40V Kobalt. Most reviews of this type of mower are mostly positive which makes the choice even more difficult. I already own 2 of the Kobalt 40v tools and have 2 2.0ah batteries so that basically made my decision for me. The battery life seems to be the only major issue with this type of mower. Well let me tell you I was very impressed! Got it home today assembled (maybe 10 min) put the 5ah battery on the charger which says about 2.5 hours on initial charge but I could not wait to try it so what the heck popped in my fully charged (3yr old) 40v 2.0ah battery and fired it up. I started mowing and did almost my whole yard (6500 sq ft mow area) before the 2.0ah battery quit on me so I popped in my 2.0ah battery from my 40v weed trimmer (3yr old) and finished the rest of my yard and had enough battery to finish trimming and blowing off drive way and still didnt stop. So I will have plenty of battery life performance with the new 5.0ah batteryI am sure! So if you already have any 40v tools and have battery life concerns its really a no brainer to me. It was light weight and easy to push. Easy 1 height adjustment for all 4 wheels. So in closing I did about 6500 sq ft with 2 2.0ah batteries and have extra to clean up and trim. I do recommend this product!
reviews.author: ebass

reviews.title: "I'm Sold"
reviews.text: At first I was leery if this would have enough power to do the job, but after one mow I was sold! We just moved into a new house and the grass was really tall, hadn't been cut in a month. This mower went through it like a champ. There are 5 setting heights which is awesome. This was a good buy!
reviews.author: CGood

reviews.title: "Perfect for small/medium lawns!"
reviews.text: This mower has been outstanding thus far.  Granted, I've only used it twice, but it's extremely easy to operate and makes a great cut.  It also folds up nicely for better storage.  Battery life certainly isn't an issue if you have an 1/8 to 1/6 size yard... and can be plugged into other Kobalt yard tools like weed whackers and blowers making life a little easier.  I will update if I find issues... but I don't anticipate that for some time.
reviews.author: JLB

reviews.title: "Love it works great"
reviews.text: Being a senior I can no longer start a gas mower. I had to have something that I could use and this is perfect. It does a great job. I wish I had spent a bit more and got the self propelled. I am a woman in early 70's and really needed something easy to use it is, however our ground is rough and a self propelled would have been much better for me. However I did not have an extra hundred to spend on it. I am happy with this one and if I should need another would get if the funds available a self propelled.
reviews.author: Linda

reviews.title: "Cordless 40vt Lawnmower"
reviews.text: I purchased the 40 vt for $299.00 after much research. Started mowing two hours after i returned home and was very happy with my purchase. It is quiet like they say, mowed 5000 sq ft of lawn on a singlr charge. Now time will tell how will the battery and lawnmower hild up.
reviews.author: Benjamin

reviews.title: "Excellent Mower"
reviews.text: Really enjoy the quiet operation and light weight. Charge doesn't last for the entire 1/2 acre, but who cant use a rest. Too light for heavy grass or wooded area (fallen wood) but great for most yards. Fair price. Highly Recommended for suburban yards of 1/3 acre or less.
reviews.author: Walt

reviews.title: "Electric mower"
reviews.text: I bought this for my mother inlaw more for convenience than anything else.No gas to mess with no oil to change no pulling to start.You just charge and go it ended up working amazing for her .So if you want a low maintenance mower that is easy to use this is the one.
reviews.author: Brett

reviews.title: "Love this thing!"
reviews.text: Going from a Corded to a cordless lawnmower is one of the greatest decisions I've made in my life; far in my list of Top 10 decisions which includes getting married, having a baby and saying yes to a new job offer. I also love all Kobalt products. Very reliable.
reviews.author: Matt

reviews.title: "So far so great"
reviews.text: Originally I was looking at a more expensive higher voltage product but after speaking with the Lowe's sales person I chose this one and could not be happier. The battery last surprisingly long time and I do a lot of power and it is very quiet. Very satisfied.
reviews.author: Jjjjjjjjj

reviews.title: "Great small machine"
reviews.text: I am using this mower for more then a year. Very light to handle, low noise and most importantly, it is working. I did not buy a second battery and I have to wait to re-charge. I manage to cut the grass in 3/4 of an acre in three charges. No problems at all.
reviews.author: LenVA

reviews.title: "Awesome battery powered lawn mower"
reviews.text: I live in a trailer park and I wanted something that would cut my lawn. I didnt want a gas lawn mower. I love how you can store it up right. I will certainly recommend this to my friends. It's quiet too. It feels like a gas mower too; with its solid frame.
reviews.author: Adamw650

reviews.title: "Perfect for us"
reviews.text: I did a lot of research before buying our first electric mower. I'd known for several years that we were a good candidate, as our small (1/4-acre) lot is probably 50% beds, so not a lot of grass. Also, we don't anguish over having perfect turf, so I didn't predict that electric-mower's well-described tendency to be a bit, uhm, uneven, was going to be a problem. We bought an open-box model yesterday and couldn't be more pleased. Really sort of set it up to fail: grass was tall and wet from rain earlier in the day, when we'd started the job with our gas model. Honestly, you couldn't tell the difference (and we keep the gas mower in good shape, ie, regular replacement or sharpening of the blade). Because it was open box, and the end of the season, we got a steep discount. But honestly, it would have been worth it at full price. Plus, I'd already bought a Kobalt trimmer this year, which I love, and they use the same battery. It's so great to get away from gas, as our yard is modest in size and these tools are quite up to the job.
reviews.author: RudigerVT

reviews.title: "Not a good product"
reviews.text: I've had a terrible time with this mower, which is disappointing because it initially looked like a good product.  When I first bought it in 2016, the battery life was good and it had good cutting power.  But it stopped turning on after a year and they sent me a replacement, which was supposed to also fix a problem where the motor could start smoking.2 years later, this summer, my replacement lawnmower starts spewing smoke out of the bottom, so clearly the fix for the motor did not work, or they sent me the wrong replacement.  The product has a 5 year warranty and it's 3 years old, so I've called the support number twice about a replacement.  Both times the support person gave me some evasive answers that "the vendor would call me back", and I haven't heard from the vendor yet.Hopefully Kobalt can fix some of these things because the product shows promise.  But as is I definitely don't recommend anyone buy this product.
reviews.author: Daniel

reviews.title: "Love it!"
reviews.text: Replaced my 15-yr old Murray...Could not be happier! Cuts great, does my approx 2000 sq ft lawn on a single charge. And, I'm cutting enough to fill the bag twice. Recharges in about two hours. Folds up and stands up -- takes up much less space than my Murray plus, my garage doesn't smell like gas any more. It's a little lighter than my gas mower. Cutting height adjustment is too easy -- one lever EASILY raises or lowers the deck. Also, got a $200 rebate from AQMD in SoCal for scrapping my gas burner.
reviews.author: SoCalMac

reviews.title: "Great for small yards"
reviews.text: I was a bit skeptical about switching from a gas mower to a battery mower. But this mower got the job done. I'm throwing out my gas can today. I recommend this mower to anyone with a smaller yard. I have under a 1/2 acre and it got it cut in one charge.
reviews.author: Al

reviews.title: "Very Pleased"
reviews.text: I have already recommended this mower to others. When my gas mower died, I decided to give this a try. Last year I bought the 40volt blower and was please with the power and battery life. so then came the hedge trimmer and then the string trimmer. The ease of just slapping in a battery and your good to go, cannot be overstated.  Lawn Mower: I have an 1/2 acre lot and it takes about 1 1/4 batteries. Light weight but also light weight construction. No issues so far. I wouldn't recommended it for heavy brush but does a great job on an established lawn. Battery: Love these Lithium batteries. 10 years ago, I had the whole collection of B&D's outdoor tools with NiCad batteries. Those batteries became unusable after one season(running time dropped fast and took forever to charge). I can fully charge these Lithium batteries in about an hour(may take longer after heavy use and if the battery gets hot). I can fully charge the Li batteries, come back in a week and still find a full charge(NiCad- fully charge, come back next day, 75% charge).
reviews.author: Topwatch

reviews.title: "Good product, but durability kinda sucks"
reviews.text: I used this for entire year and it worked like a charm. Upon storing, the control unit got some damage and item no longer works.  I took a look and terminals were poorly don (just expected knotted).  Great, but will not last without improvements.
reviews.author: timmmie7797

reviews.title: "perfect!"
reviews.text: got this to replace old yard machine gas mower...  zero issues wth cut or power anything... also got the blower and weed wacker  all with batteries  i mowed/weedwacked/blowered whole 1/3 acre on two batteries....  glad i made the leap to electric!!
reviews.author: Kelley

reviews.title: "Battery failure"
reviews.text: I got to mow the grass 4 times with no issue. Today the battery is dead and the charger isnt charging. There is no indicator that the charger is even trying to charge the battery. After calling Kobalt I am on a waiting list to get a return call concerning this and the wait time for the call just to start is up to 5 business days. Ill let the grass know. In over 40 years of taking care of my yard this is a new experience. It would have been ok but waiting up to 5 days to even start a conversation on resolution is not acceptable to me. I dont recommend trying you first experience with an electric mower with Kobalt. If I had it to do over I would have started with a company with an already good reputation like Toro which is where I am on my way to now but I wont be buying it at Lowes either.
reviews.author: Rodney

reviews.title: "Perfect size mower"
reviews.text: Clearly for pure ease of operating it's hard to beat this size mower.Lightweight as well as powerful this is the perfect size for a smaller size yard. Easily stored upright it lends itself to the smaller sized environment.It is ready when you are.
reviews.author: Fabio

reviews.title: "40 Volt Kobalt Mower"
reviews.text: The mower works pretty good. My only complaint is a staggered warranty policy. The mower is warranted for 5 years but the battery is only 3 years. I purchased in Sept. 2015 (42 Mos.) I went on line and chatted with a rep hoping to get a free replacement or at least a discount. I am a "MyLowes" member and use a Lowes CC with Military rider. Essentially the chat tech said "tough luck, a replacement battery is $149.00.) I also purchased a 40 Volt Kobalt blower but the battery is a lighter 2AH battery.
reviews.author: JRS

reviews.title: "Watch the batteries!"
reviews.text: the 40 volt extended run 5 amp batteries are having performance issues after 12 -18 months.   Lowes does not seem to be able to stock the extended run 5 amp batteries or warranty them in a timely manner.  These batteries need to be improved.
reviews.author: George

reviews.title: "Great machine"
reviews.text: Works great, starts very easy, very quiet, lawn was a little  higher than normal first time it was used not  a  problem  for this machine and there is plenty  of battery  to do the  job, lawn cùtting time is probably  about  30  minutes.
reviews.author: Ron

reviews.title: "Just what I needed"
reviews.text: I have a medium sized yard and it's perfect! Now I did buy a string trimmer as well so I'd have 2 batteries and they're a necessity for my yard. I just didn't want to pay way more just for longer battery life when I needed both anyway
reviews.author: Rayann

reviews.title: "Great mower"
reviews.text: I have a lawn service that cuts most of my yard but I have a small area that is a hassle to let them get to ( multiple gates and dogs). This mower is perfect for that area. One battery does the job easily. All in all a great mower.
reviews.author: Rocky

reviews.title: "Great mower"
reviews.text: I have a lawn service that cuts most of my yard but I have a small area that is a hassle to let them get to ( multiple gates and dogs). This mower is perfect for that area. One battery does the job easily. All in all a great mower.
reviews.author: Rocky

reviews.title: "great for small yards."
reviews.text: Very good cordless lawnmower for the price. I have about 1500-2000 sq ft of grass and it'll last.  Not ideal for overgrown grass (over 8 inches) because the motor will stop.  but awesome machine for yards with regular maintenance.
reviews.author: jcastro619

reviews.title: "Batteries are trash"
reviews.text: Had this mower for a year and I've purchased 2 batteries already. Battery that came with it will no longer charge. Also the batteries don't last 20 minutes when you're only running the blade. Forget about self propelled.
reviews.author: Tbone

reviews.title: "Kobalt 40v lawnmower"

reviews.title: "GREAT PRODUCTS"
reviews.text: I am enjoying the 3 Kobalt products, blower, weedeater which ive had 2 yrs, and lastly the mower which ive only had 3 months but I am loving so far.  The manufacturer claims are true as far as batteries and functionality.

reviews.title: "Great Mower"
reviews.text: Have had the mower for about 4 weeks and mowed with it 5 times it did a great job. The battery last longer then it take me to mow about 45 minutes. Very glad I purchased the mower it does a better job than I though.

reviews.title: "great mower"

reviews.author: viktor

reviews.title: "Great Lawnmower!!!!!"
reviews.text: I would so buy this lawn mower again. Very quiet, cuts great, easy to push even without the self propelled model and you don't need gas, oil or spark plugs!  just keep the battery charged and your ready to go.
reviews.author: SP

reviews.title: "Awesome cordless mower"
reviews.text: I purchased this mower to replace a walk-assist mower that was difficult for me to handle. I had seen this mower on display at Lowes and liked that it seemed to be well built and light in weight. I also liked the fact that it was a cordless, electric mower. After about 3 weeks of mowing every three to four days, I feel this mower is definitely worth the money spent for it. It has performed very well. It takes me about 30 - 40 minutes to mow my lawn and the battery has been lasting the whole time. I usually have 1/4 showing on the gauge when I get done. I have only used it in the mulch mode and it mulches the grass into a fine mulch. I am extremely happy with the mulch. The mower handles very well and pushes easily. The height adjustment control is easy to use and the mower is very quiet while using.Overall I am very glad I purchased this mower and would recommend it to anyone wanting to use a push mower, good exercise. If the battery lasts for 3 years and the mower for 5 as advertised, I will be very satisfied. I would purchase another one of these when the time comes to replace it.
reviews.author: firechief

reviews.title: "Great machine for a 40 minute lawn"
reviews.text: No need for a loud mower that requires gas, oil, and regular maintenance--this is the perfect machine for a small yard. It's light and easy to maneuver around obstacles, fence posts, etc.  The negative reviews about charge time are not fair to the design goals of this unit. Read the box and manual:  it is intended for smaller yards--ones that can be mowed in 35-40 minutes or so. My lawn takes approximately 30 minutes to mow and I had two bars remaining.  This is my first foray into electric mowers and I'm happy with where I landed with the 40V Kobalt. I mulch only, and so far--the results are as good as any gas mower I've used--only better due to the instant start and reduced upkeep. By the way--this is a light machine and I do not miss the self-driving feature of the more expensive models.  Highly recommended for smaller lawns.  I am considering the 80V for my father's large lawn which I also maintain. Highly recommended!
reviews.author: John

reviews.title: "Kobalt Battery Mower"
reviews.text: Bought this mower for my elderly parents and would have to say it is the best choice I've ever made.  Light weight, no pull start.  Push a button and go for them.  Would recommend to anybody.
reviews.author: Lisa

reviews.title: "TERRIBLE, FRUSTRATING and TIME CONSUMING!"
reviews.text: **I could buy a cheap lawnmower for the price of one of these batteries and it would do a better job of cutting the grass in less time!!!**I chose this lawnmower to get away from gas thinking I would be saving time and money by investing in electric. I thought that I would not have to go to the store to get gas but in turn I spend more time waiting for the batteries to charge because the charge doesn't even last long enough to do my front yard!It would have been LESS time consuming and less frustrating to have to pick up gas while gassing up my truck at the same time than waiting for these stupid batteries to charge just the do my front yard, and then I still have to do my backyard! It's RIDICULOUS! I will never recommend this brand or this company ever again. This is after only one week, from Saturday to the next Saturday. The grass doesn't even get that tall but it's too much for this lawn mower to handle, it runs it out of battery power in 20 minutes, if I'm lucky... Realistically if I wanted to mow my front yard AND my backyard I would need to 3 or 4 batteries! Except the batteries are VERY expensive... In the attached picture you can barely even tell the difference between the grass I cut and the grass that I haven't cut. I was just trying to make it even and flat! ** I been trying for 30 minutes to attach a picture less than 5MB but it will not load no matter how many times I try to upload a 3mb picture. Yay, even this website is terrible!** I wish I could turn this thing back in for a full refund. I'd drop everything and do it right now then go buy an $80 gas mower that would do a BETTER job in less time.Highly not recommended! Buy a cheap gas mower and save time, money and frustration.
reviews.author: Austin

reviews.title: "Great purchase"
reviews.text: Quiet. Gets the job done. Wish is had a slightly longer battery life and wish I could start charging right after usage, but I have to wait because the charger says the battery is too hot.
reviews.author: Mari

reviews.title: "Owner"
reviews.text: Lawnmower  works great but after a month the battery wouldn't take a charge. After calling Lowes to see if we could get a new battery they said that we needed to return the lawnmower because we couldn't exchange just the battery. We needed to contact the manufacturer (isn't Lowe's the manufacturer of Kobalt, I'm at a loss). This is my first experience returning something to Lowe's, hope that I don't have thru this again because I own other kobalt battery operated tools and hand tools.
reviews.author: Angel

reviews.title: "I love it"
reviews.text: I bought the Kobalt 40-volt Brushless Lithium Ion 20-in Cordless Electric Lawn Mower on 05/14/2018 for $299. It came equipped with a 5-amp battery and charger. I bought it on a Monday night after my old gas-powered mower finally bit the dust halfway through mowing my front lawn. The following day, I was actually excited to get home and cut the grass, so that I could test out my new Kobalt lawn mower. To my chagrin, a storm passed through right after I made it home and was about to begin mowing. I thought I'd have to wait until the following day to try out my new toy. Thankfully, though, the storm passed rather quickly without raining all that much. I decided to at least try to finish cutting my front lawn (it looked bad being halfway cut). Despite the grass being wet, the Kobalt 40-volt mower knocked it down without any fuss (I set the cut depth to the next to lowest setting). I loved how quiet the mower was and how light it was compared to my old gas-powered mower. Feeling confident, I decided to tackle my much larger (and wet) backyard (40ftx20ft). I wasn't sure if the 5-amp battery would be up to the task, but my concerns were put to rest. It handled the job like a champ. When I finished it, the battery still had about a full bar left. I'm very satisfied with my purchase and, as crazy as it sounds, can't wait to cut my grass again. The battery's longevity will, obviously, be the true test of satisfaction. I'm trusting it will last the test of time, so long as I take good care of it.The cherry on the cake is that I noticed this mower's price was discounted to $249 for Memorial Day on 05/16/2018 (just two days after I purchased it). I promptly took my receipt to the customer help desk at Lowe's for a price match and they refunded me $50!
reviews.author: Josh

reviews.title: "Solid Lawn Mower"
reviews.text: Easy setup and works reasonably well. First time using it in the season, it quit several times due to the grass being long at that point. Other than that, this is a solid product.

The battery lasted perfectly for the size of my yard, and to top it off I also own the Weedwhacker so I can inter-change batteries as needed for bigger jobs!  Plus living in Hawaii, I definitely appreciate that it does not put out any pollution to run it, and it's a lot quieter than a traditional lawn mower, and I'm helping maintain a low carbon footprint by charging the battery through my solar set up!

reviews.title: "Extremely impressed"
reviews.text: Needed a new mower obviously....got this one. Picked it up during lunch break, coworkers already want one for themselves. Well worth it. It mowed down high grass without an issue. My old gas one woulda been bogging down. Adjusting it is so easy and fast. I cut the high grass at the high setting then went over it again at a lower one. The battery lasted the entire time I needed to finish my yard and the front of my neighbors. I'm actually excited to get out and use it again.
reviews.author: Lee

reviews.title: "Beyond My Expectations"
reviews.text:
Have been using a 40 volt Lithium ion trimmer for 2 years with great results. Based on this experience I decided to try the 40 volt Cordless Electric Push Lawn Mover to handle some, if not all, the trimming around my lawn.
I unpacked the unit, set up the charger and battery and took the time to read the instructions while the battery was charging. I really like the features which allows simple height adjustment, not needing gas or oil or having to prime the engine, set the choke or to pull a cord. The safety switch is really important if small children are around and its use will become part of my routine even though we do not have any children present.
 My existing lawn mower is self propelled but is 3 times the weight and is difficult to use as a trimmer around trees and bushes. Both units have a 20 inch steel blade and therefore cut the same swat per pass.
After I charged the battery, I simply installed it, set the safety switch and adjusted the deck height and I was ready to go. My lawn was about 4 inches tall and I used the new lawn mover for about 15 minutes before my wife wanted to try it. She normally does all the trimming and I don't think I'll get to use the new mower again because she thinks it is a dream to use and so much easier on her back.
We cut and trim about 2 acres utilizing a garden tractor, lawn mover and trimmer. This new unit will eliminate the gas lawn mower and about 80 percent of the trimmers use.
When we were finished the battery still had power left. I still put it back on the charger so it would be at its peak next week.
Over all I think this is more then enough lawn mower for the typical home owner. It came with a rear bagger attachment, simple to use mulching insert and a side discharge chute. This covers everything you may want the lawn mover to do. It is easy to use and easy to change attachments. 
After we finished I pulled the safety switched and battery, cleaned the underside of the deck, folded the handle and hung the unit up next to my other lawn tools.
reviews.author: Handyvan

reviews.title: "Works well with my small lot"
reviews.text: Have used this mower 3 times. I wanted one that didn't need gas or oil. Decided on this one after reading reviews. I have been able.to mow on one charge. My lot size is small, 60 by 100, tract houses close together. The mower is very quiet. It is powerful enough to cut grass around 4 to 5 in high. I had to adjust to level 4 to cut higher, thicker grass in backyard. Engine speeds up when cutting thick area. Have a slope on side and partial one in front. Need to be careful if you have soil erosion or partly bumpy slope. My old mower was a gas powered front wheel drive self.propelled. I am 61 years old. Using a push  mower iz a little more demanding for me on the slope areas. The mower is still pretty light to push though.I have been able to finish the yard without recharging battery. I would not use this on wet grass as think would scratch up mower cleaning it. I think it does a good job on a small yard, is quiet, and like not having to keep gas and.oil in garage. Would recommend this mower to anyone with a smaller lot. Cons:Harder to push on a slope part of yard. Pro:No need for gas or oil, quiet, light weight for push mower, cuts well, height easy to adjust.
reviews.author: Misty74

reviews.title: "Excellent mower!"
reviews.text: Plenty of power and the battery lasts long enough to mow my modest-sized front and back yards three times on a single charge.
reviews.author: Bill

reviews.title: "Great Product, Know You Job"
reviews.text: I purchased this for my townhome/semi detached. I came from a large yard requiring commercial grade equipment. I knew what I needed for that property and I knew what I needed for this property. For this small yard which takes 20 minutes tops, all flat, this is the right tool. I can get 2 cuts, 2 trims and blow sidewalks clear on 2 batteries. Quality is good, assembly easy for 40v push mower, weed wacker/string trimmer and leaf blower. My advice is know your requirements. If you are realistic about what this will do for you then it is great. How ever these tools would be useless for my last property with a large/long driveway, lots of trimming and finish mowing. Proper care of batteries and you will get 40 minutes of use. I read reviews when people said these products do not perform well, they perform well for small jobs. If the products are not delivering, the customer should have opted for equipment suited for the work they need to accomplish. I would recommend these products and would purchase all over again based on my experiences using them. I will update at end of Summer 19. Lowe's staff was very helpful picking the right equipment for my requirements.

reviews.author: Fred

reviews.title: "great machine"
reviews.text: There is almost nothing not to like about the Kobalt 40V mower. It comes in a box. I found it easy to lean the box on its side, then slit the bottom of the box as well as the top of the box. Then I positioned it so the bottom flaps were open and set the box down upright. I opened the top of the box, removed the loose materials such as the battery, batter charger, etc. I removed the packing materials, then lifted the box off the mower. It's not a heavy mower, but opening the box this way avoids having to lift the 40 pounds or so of mower up and out of the box. Easy for one person to do. Next, I read the simple instructions, then charged and installed the battery. Finally, I attached the handle, put in the mulch plug, put in the side discharge, set the height and the handle position, and was ready to go. Lawn mowers are pretty intuitive to operate these days and the Kobalt is no different. There is no need to go into the operation since the Kobalt operates like any modern mower. Starting and restarting is as simple as pushing a button and pulling back on the handle. Now for the good and bad. Not much bad. I have an 8 thousand square foot yard. I found I could mow about two thirds of it on a single charge of the battery. Since I'm older, I prefer not to mow the front and back on the same day. So, no problem with the operating time of the battery. The Kobalt has a 20 inch deck. Not the largest of cutting widths, but not bad. I love not having to go to buy (and then store) gas. Maintenance is very simple. Good power. Weeds, grass, and everything I need to cut is absolutely no problem. I just tipped the mower over on its side when I finished mowing, used a wooden spoon to clean out under the deck, and whisked the loose grass off the top. Nice to know that when I tip the mower on its side, I don't have to worry about gas or oil spilling out. Storing is a breeze. I can store it vertically with the handle folded in, but since I have the space, I just wheeled the Kobalt into the garage and into its place. I've had one battery powered mower in the past and find the two similar. The advantage of the Kobalt, for me, is the slightly larger cutting width and the fact that it ran a little quieter than the old one. Great product and highly recommended.
reviews.author: Bill

reviews.title: "Lots Of Reasons"
reviews.text: We bought this lawn mower three years ago and used it for two summers. It ran quietly and well, and we were happy about the fact that it's not gas-powered. We have used electric lawn mowers, either battery or corded, for several years.The battery didn't last nearly long enough to mow our front and back lawns even though we do not have a large yard and it only took about 45 minutes to do them both on a bad day when the grass was long and we were moving slowly. We decided in the end to spend an extra hundred bucks for an extra battery. It was too much of a hassle spending two days on the yard every week.So now the third summer of our lawn mower has arrived and the mower won't start. The battery is definitely not the problem since we have two, both are fully charged, and we've tried both. We called Lowe's and they said we have to call Kobalt to see about getting it repaired, which surprised me because I thought we were covered for five years. Kobalt said they need an "item number" from the manual that came with our mower before they could tell us anything about getting it repaired.We're thinking maybe this particular mower was a really stupid decision on our part. I do not recommend it.

reviews.author: Sean

reviews.title: "Amazing New Technology"
reviews.text: This Kobalt lithium Ion mower is actually relaxing to operate! The quiet hum of the battery, the lightness of the mower when compared to a gas mower, the medium sized wheels and the push button/bail bar start make this mower fun to operate. I ran the mower for 50 minutes straight without a pause in power. I have another battery ready so in less than a minute I am up and going again. There is a larger mower that has two batteries already in the mower and is a 21 inch instead of 20 inch mower. No switching of batteries is necessary. This mower is presently $239 and the upgrade is $449. I personally don't think it would be worth $210 more dollars This 40-Volt must have a feature that kicks it into a higher power when you are in deeper grass. I experienced the extra power. The pros are 1) All wheel adjustment lever, 2) Easy start, 3) Quiet, peaceful motor, 4) Green, 5) No gas or oil smell in air and body/clothes, 6) No gas and oil purchases, and, 7) Mulch, bag or use discharge chute. This mower is for use in a home setting that has relatively flat lawns. Cutting your lawn no less than every other week should keep your lawn cutting experience an easy and enjoyable event. The price easily compares to a gas mower.

reviews.author: Akro

reviews.title: "Love this whole 40v system"
reviews.text: This is my second Kobalt cordless mower. I bought the dual battery/dual 10 inch blade mower in 2013 for $449. It still works (even the batteries!), and I donated it to a friend for a charity yard sale. The only thing I didn't like was that it seemed the blades got dull relatively quick. I had two sets that I kept sharpened and swapped out. Anyway this new one is even better and a better value. It takes me about 30 minutes to mow my yard and when I am done the battery has two or three lights left of charge. The old one was mostly plastic. I like that this one has a metal deck and looks more like a traditional mower. It's like mowing my lawn with a box fan, so quiet. It's great to be able to do yard work and just smell like grass rather than gas exhaust. I also have the original trimmer and blower from 2013. At the time you got an extra battery free with purchase so I have a few 2.0Ah batteries to use with all these tools. All still work. Recently added the hedge trimmer to the arsenal. I also like the 5 year warranty. I don't think there are any gas mowers at this price with a warranty that long. Anyone with a small to medium size yard should look into this mower. Already had a neighbor borrow it and he's going to purchase one soon.
reviews.author: Shawnw

reviews.title: "Nice Mower"
reviews.text: I have been running this mower for three years now. This is my first electric mower.  I have a small area to mow 2500 square feet.  Between the two batteries that came with it I get two weeks of mowing.  I put one on the charger each week. I do mow each week so the grass doesn't get too tall. The only thing I can complain about is coming from a high dollar 22 inch gas mower is it doesn't vacuum the lawn as well.  Now I have to rake the leaves before I cut.
reviews.author: jonb

reviews.title: "Great Machine"
reviews.text: This is the 1st battery powered mower I've owned and I'm very happy with it.  It's very light and easy to push so no need for a self-propelled mower.  Very easy to change the settings for height. Plenty of battery power for me to completely mow my yard for 50 minutes without recharging.  And, most importantly, it does a perfect job on my lawn.
reviews.author: Cliff

reviews.text: There is no review to accompany this rating.
reviews.author: Angie

reviews.text: There is no review to accompany this rating.
reviews.author: KP

reviews.text: There is no review to accompany this rating.
reviews.author: Dottie

reviews.text: There is no review to accompany this rating.
reviews.author: Uthboth

reviews.text: There is no review to accompany this rating.
reviews.author: Leeanne

reviews.title: "WORST MOWER I'VE EVER USED"
reviews.text: Battery dies extremely fast & does not cut tall grass well. Constantly stopping an starting again & again & again. It's ridiculous how much of a bad mower this really is. Would never recommend to anyone. I'd rather cut the grass with my teeth than to use this mower again. Please avoid at all cost!
reviews.author: Tyler

reviews.title: "Goodbye Gardeners!"
reviews.text: I'd had it with my gardeners so, after doing my research, I purchased the Kobalt 40V Cordless Electric Lawn Mower.  It's smaller, lightweight, easy to start and handle, quiet, and I'm able to mow twice off a single charge.  Having never mowed my own lawn before, I have to admit, I was impressed and it looks professionally done.  This is a great lawn mower for most, especially if you're a small, 65-year old woman wanting to save a bundle on gardeners.
reviews.author: Kim

reviews.title: "This lawnmower is a BEAST!!"
reviews.text: Purchased this mower for my son and his girlfriend who recently purchased a townhome with a small yard (1/4 acre). Very sturdy mower...nicely built. Light weight and easy to handle. Had it set up and ready for use in less than 10 minutes. Very fast battery charge. I offered to cut their yard because I wanted to try the mower out and see how powerful and quality of cut. I must say I was totally blown away by the ease of use, quiteness of motor and the quality of cut. My sons yard is very hilly and the cut remained even throughout and the mower was light enough to comfortably handle the pushing up and down the hills. Cut whole yard on the same charge and the mulch function worked extremely well with no clippings shown. Also bought a Kobalt battery edger and since the batteries are the same.....they can be interchanged as needed (backup).
reviews.author: CP

reviews.title: "Doesn't come with battery!"
reviews.text: Heads up in case you missed the fine print like I did.  I purchased as part of Memorial Day sale for around $200, great price right?  Wrong when it doesn't include the Battery or a charger.  When I found those would be an addition $100 or so I promptly returned the mower.Save your money and headache and just get a gas powered mower.
reviews.author: Joe

reviews.title: "Why did I wait so long??"
reviews.text: Finally got tired of taking the gas mower to the shop for tune-ups and bought this mower. Why did I wait so long? Wow, THIS MOWER IS AWESOME !! Right out of the box, I decided to endurance test it. I mowed my 5500 sq ft lot when the grass was 4 inches tall and totally wet with dew. This mower had no problems with it, plenty of power and battery for the job. I'm impressed and with a 5yr tool and 3yr battery warranty there was no risk.
reviews.author: Emmette

reviews.title: "Kobalt 40v battery mower - AWESOME"
reviews.text: This is the best money I have ever spent.   The product is very well built, performs greater than expected is easy to use.   I am impressed with the safety considerations to this mower, especially the safety key.   Additionally the three yr battery warranty is tremendous peace of mind
reviews.author: John

reviews.title: "I really wanted to like this mower"
reviews.text: I bought this mower about five weeks ago and have mowed my lawn in all sorts of conditions to really test this out. The first mow was super long grass, the second mow was short grass. Both using the side chute for clippings. Mow number 3 used the mulching setting on dewy grass. Mows 4 and 5 were mulching short dry grass.First things first, I bought the 40v trimmer along with the mower because I wanted an extra battery. Stupid me, I didn't check the AmpH to see that the trimmer batter was less than half the capacity of the mower. Trimmer battery lasts about 15 minutes in this mower. The mower battery lasts around 40.The main problem I have with this mower is battery life. I have a relatively small yard. In general, I should be able to mow and trim the whole thing in under 45 minutes. I have only once been able to do that using the two batteries I own on a single charge. The charge time on these takes so long that you can forget about charging while you mow, trim, or do other yardwork. Frustration with the batteries has turned what should be a simple job into a headache every weekend.Now, you may be thinking, "hey, just buy another battery." That's a good idea. But that brings up the next problem: the price point. This mower was $279. For that amount of cash you can get a *very* nice gas mower. If I wanted to buy another battery for this mower equal to the capacity of the original mower battery, it would cost another $150. No amount of maintenance and fuel costs on a gas mower would ever bring the actual cost of this electric mower even remotely close to its gas counterparts. I really wanted to like this mower. I really wanted to go electric. But my goodness this actual cost is absurd. Honestly, I'm frustrated enough with the battery situation to give this a 1* review. However, everything about this mower "works" so you get a bonus star. Congrats on the pyrrhic victory.
reviews.author: Dan

reviews.title: "Lightweight & easy to use"
reviews.text: I like nearly everything about this mower. From unboxing to a finished lawn was as painless as yardwork can be. The combo of minimal assembly and good instructions made for an easy start. The height adjustment was straightforward and required little effort. The battery is solid and compact. This mower is much lighter than comparable gasoline mowers. Mowing my hill was much easier than I expected as a result. There is a kill plug to prevent accidental starting during storage or when you're cleaning and maintaining the blade. One of my favorite features is the vertical storage ability. This reduces the garage storage space to about a 3'x1' rectangle on the floor and provides easy access to the blade for maintenance. The way it folds up allows you to move it around like a hand truck. The downsides are not many, but there are some. The battery takes a long time to charge, but it's not unreasonable. It advertises a 40 minute run time, which is about what it takes to do my lawn. I didn't run into any issues running out of power, but if your lawn is larger you may want to invest in additional batteries so you don't have to wait for it to charge to finish the job. The only other issue I see is the kill plug. The book says to remove the plug for storage, but there's no place to mount it so it's just sitting there under the battery cover. I feel it would easily fall out and get lost if someone wasn't paying attention. I may make a lanyard to keep it in place. Overall, if your relationship with small engines is like mine, this is a definite buy that you should feel good about.
reviews.author: Tommy

reviews.title: "This lawnmower is only good at first"
reviews.text: The battery dies so fast. I have to get a new battery every season. I have a small lawn and I can't make it through a mowing without he battery's dying. And I don't Leave the battery on the charger around the clock (because that would wear it down even faster). and it's impossible to charge the battery. It's like solving a rubics cube. It worked like a charm at first, but I need another solution now. (2 years in)
reviews.author: YouMustAcquit

reviews.title: "This thing is a piece of junk"
reviews.text: We have had this mower for about a year and a half and now I can not even mow my back yard with 3 FULLY CHARGED batteries. I would not recommend buying this thing at all. I have had problems with it since the beginning but I have dealt with it since we spent $250 on this and we also bought the weed eater and the blower. I will never buy anything kobalt and electric again. Be forewarned that this product is junk
reviews.author: Chris

reviews.title: "Kobalt Cordless Mower"
reviews.text: I have used gas mowers in the past and a saw a friend's cordless mower which prompted the purchase.  Easy assembly of the mower's handle.  Some issues with the initial battery charge (proper insertion on the charger required) but finally got the correct light pattern on the battery.    Good height adjustment options and the mower is quiet.  Moves easily with the larger rear wheels.  So far, an excellent value.
reviews.author: bradyl22

reviews.title: "Life withot gas is good"
reviews.text: Went in to by a traditional moweras my 16 year old model finally died.  Salesman answered all my questions about the Craftsman,  and then asked if I wold consider battery.  After reviewing features the Kobalt was the choice.  I have cot the lawn three times and love the ease of se,  the light weight.  Only thing I wold change wold be to make the catcher bag bigger.  Not really an issue.  Assembly is easy!
reviews.author: Andy

reviews.title: "Impressed"
reviews.text: I was sick of messing with mowers with carborators that are constantly getting gunked up.Bought this with a little hesitation but after mowing my yard with it I am very impressed. Mows great and doesn't bog down even in thick wet grass.
reviews.author: Jerry

reviews.title: "buy scissors, they work better"
reviews.text: Awful. Cheap. Has little power and about the same battery performance. Just bought this “toy” thinking we were being environmentally friendly. Turns out, we are, because it barely runs.  Save yourself the $ and frustration.
reviews.author: Todd

reviews.title: "Works well but dies fast"
reviews.text: We have a fairly small yard. Not too big not too small and we have to mow in two separate times while waiting for the battery to charge back up. This is very unfortunate because the machine works so well and is very quiet.
reviews.author: Savannah

reviews.title: "So far, so good and other cliches."
reviews.text: It knows when to power up when going through thick grass. So far the battery holds enough power for me to cut the whole lawn, which isn't saying much cuz I have a small lawn. So yeah, buy it, don't buy it, I don't care.
reviews.author: James

reviews.title: "Great Mower!"
reviews.text: Excellent mower - quiet and very easy to use. Went from a gas self-propelled troy-bilt to this and I won't be looking back. I have about a quarter of an acre of mildly wooded lawn to mow and this does it perfectly. I can easily turn it off, move branches/brush that need cleared out, and turn it right back on and keep going. Great mower, great battery life. I'll be trying the trimmer next.
reviews.author: Eric

reviews.title: "Finally a alternative to gas mowing"
reviews.text: I was optimistic about purchasing a battery operated lawnmower. After mowing my yard with this Kobalt 40v mower I was pleasantly surprised. Time will tell if this was a wise purchase. They already have 80v mowers out and they dropped the price $100 on the 40v system. It came with a heavy duty battery that had plenty of charge left. I am sold on this for now and as stated time will tell.
reviews.author: PatP

reviews.title: "Love, love love!"
reviews.text: I wish I'd had a mower like this years ago. Super easy to start, don't have to fool with gasoline, and so much easier for me to push.(I'm 65)My yard is not that big, but it definitely has a steep slope to it, but I could handle it with ease.  The battery will usually be good for at least 2 mowings. Going to try to mulch my fall leaves tomorrow.. will report back on how that turned out
reviews.author: Kim

reviews.title: "Kobalt 40V 20" Electric Lawn Mower"
reviews.text: I've only used this mower 3 times but so far I'm very happy with it.  It's easy to handle and the battery is powerful enough to cut 1/3 acre on one charge.  I'm impressed with how quickly the battery recharges too.  I do wish the battery was easier to remove and I'm unsure how long the plastic part that holds it in place is going to last but other than that I'm happy with the purchase.
reviews.author: mamaladybug

reviews.title: "Big Disappointment"
reviews.text: Needed to replace my gas powered rotary mower so I decided to give this mower a chance. There are a few good points about this mower, but there are more bad points than good. The good points are; it's quieter to operate, seems to be well built, height adjustment is accomplished with a single lever, it's light weight and very easy to push and maneuver and when you release the lever, the motor stops quickly. When mowing is completed, it folds up very nicely and actually has an integrated stand, allowing you to store it in a smaller footprint. Being able to stand it up on end also makes it very easy to clean and service with no gas leaking out of a gas tank or oil leaking into the cylinder.  The BAD points are; low power, low rpm, which means that when trying to mow, the blade isn't spinning fast enough to " lift " the grass for cutting, which leaves a lot to be desired because you have to go over the grass multiple times in order to cut the grass, still leaving at least half the grass still laying flat and uncut. I was forced to use a leaf rake to lift large areas of grass so I could re-mow it, still leaving uncut grass. ( a gas powered mower has the necessary lifting power to raise grass up to be cut because the blade is spinning so much faster, producing enough lift / vacuum to raise up tougher grasses ) Having to go through the " stupid person safety steps " is annoying; you have to initially push a button, then pull on the " bar " before the mower will start. You cannot pull the lever first, then push the start button.  There is a momentary delay before the motor winds up and runs, just not fast enough to lift the grass for cutting.  I can see where this mower will work for certain yards, but for the majority of lawns, I highly recommend you stay with the gas powered mower if you want a nicely cut lawn.  In closing, I was extremely disappointed with this mower.  I will be returning it for a gas powered mower.  This is a good idea but before I'm convinced to go with battery powered mowers, they'll have to more than double the speed / rpm of the motor and the blade.
reviews.author: WingWalker

reviews.title: "Electric mower"
reviews.text: We were apprehensive at first to get an electric mower but my husband and I are both pleasantly surprised.  We have a small back yard and it is very lightweight and easy to use.  No gasoline hassles and it's much quieter than the old mower.
reviews.author: Kate

reviews.title: "Easy Start"
reviews.text: Exactly what I wanted. I have it started in seconds without expending all my energy on the pull start. I wish the battery lasted longer but it cuts good.
reviews.author: Paul

reviews.title: "Thank you Kobalt and Lowes"
reviews.text: I had the 19" Kobalt 20v Mower, that I think they don't make anymore. I bought it two years ago and it ran great the first year, but this last year the battery's run-time got shorter and shorter. The battery got to the point that the charge lasted less than 10 minutes. I called Kobalt and was told that the mower was under a 5-year warranty, and the battery was under a 3-year. Kobalt directed me to their parts supplier, however, the battery I needed would not be available until the Fall. They offered two 20v batteries, but I didn't want that. To my surprise and without and without asking I was offered an exchange authorization. I exchanged my mower at Lowes for the 20" Kobolt again without any fuss. I can't thank Kobalt and Lowes enough for the excellent customer service. I encourage everyone to always save your receipts. I always attach mine to the owners manual and save that in a safe place. Having my receipt made all the difference. The new mower runs like a dream. I can mow early in the morning without worry of waking neighbors who want to sleep in because this mower is quite. The extra inch on the mower's deck makes a huge difference and has decreased my mowing time.
reviews.author: Kim

reviews.title: "Kobalt Rechargeable Mower"
reviews.text: This model is perfect for our moderately sized yard. Seems to be quite powerful enough even on damp grass. Battery charge is ample to do the entire yard and the noise level is very low. This is my first rechargeable mower and I appreciate not having to deal with a cord or gas/oil. I like the stand-up storage feature which saves room in the garage.
reviews.author: Tommy

reviews.title: "good for a small yard."
reviews.text: I bought this because I was tired of gas, oil changes, noise, etc.  After mowing a few times, I wish i would have bought the 80 volt mower.  I do have a rather large yard, by city standards.  I could only do about a quarter of my property on one battery life, fully charged. It does well if you have a small yard. Not a loud mower by any means.
reviews.author: mower

reviews.title: "Poor battery life"
reviews.text: I love the mower but after about a year of twice monthly use on a small 2000 square foot yard the battery dies after 15 mins of use. Based on this I have to rate it low.... otherwise I have loved the mower.
reviews.author: Diane

reviews.title: "so far i am impressed"
reviews.text: easy to assemble..works great. charge on battery good for 1/4 acre plus. i like it.
reviews.author: zorak

reviews.title: "Buy at your own risk."
reviews.text: I bought one of these electric kobalt mowers a couple of years ago. It worked ok for a while but then the battery stopped charging. Instead of giving me a new battery or a credit or something they just gave me the run around. I have since bought the ego and I like it much better. It just doesn't pay to buy one of these from Lowe's
reviews.author: Ray104

reviews.title: "Good mower for right circumstances"
reviews.text: The mower assembles with ease: two screw bolts to hold the upper part of the handle to the lower. The chute I feel does not stay attached well enough to the rod such that a bump or two easily knocks the chute off of the mower--perhaps a good thing also as this could keep it from breaking--you decide. The battery is the only area where the mower is not great. It took quite a while to charge, maybe 45 minutes to an hour and lasted for approximately 30-40 minutes. This would be more than sufficient if you had a small area to mow (city lot, edging around flower beds/trees, etc). The mower itself seemed to work quite well and did a phenomenal job mowing under our trampoline with 2 ft tall grass, honestly it seemed to do a better job with this than it did with the grass in my yard which was dry and only a few inches tall. I did not use the bagger but imagine it would work just fine. I mowed using the chute and with the chute closed to function as a mulching mower. It worked great for mulching but required moving slower, as expected. Overall this is a great mower and with the right needs and circumstances I wouldn't hesitate to recommend. For my use, it will likely only be used to mow under the trampoline and for edging a fenceline.
reviews.author: maconhurler

reviews.title: "Great Mower"
reviews.text: I submitted an entry to get this mower for $99 from the state of Utah. I did't get it for that price... They did give me a coupon for $50 dollars so I bought it. It replaced a Honda HR214 that I've had for years. We recently moved to a smaller home with a smaller yard. This mower is easy to use and does a great job on my lawn.
reviews.author: Barry

reviews.title: "Nice finish, lightweight, and easy"
reviews.text: Nice easy lawnmower to use. Minimum of parts because of the electric motor, and much lighter than the traditional small gas engine mowers. The battery has a nice long charge, though time will tell how Texas heat will treat the battery or force it to overheat and lose charge.Overall very nice and a perfect fit for our yard.
reviews.author: Chris

reviews.title: "Very Good"
reviews.text: The overall operation of the mower is very good and easy to operate and much lighter the a standard gas engine mower.  I may have missed something in the owner's manual, but the only con I have currently is it goes through batteries to quickly in my opinion.  I had to go through 4 battery charges to complete my yard.
reviews.author: ddailey

reviews.title: "not good"
reviews.text: will not run for more than 30 seconds. As the motor runs it gets warm and it shuts down. Any weather above 60 is to warm for it. Unless you mow before 6 am it takes to long to get it the done. The only thing good about this mower is  the power of the motor it is strong enough ot cut wet grass but can run long enough.
reviews.author: MB

reviews.title: "Wrong Battery in BOX"
reviews.text: The mower was advertised to come with a 40V 5.0AH battery but in the box was a 40V 4.0AH.  Called Kobalt to get the correct battery since I just purchased it a day ago.  They said they will have their battery supplier call me directly.  UGH.  If buying from Severn MD LOWES, check the box before you leave the store.
reviews.author: DaveF

reviews.title: "Well put together"
reviews.text: Cuts nicely.
reviews.author: Michael

reviews.title: "mower"
reviews.text: Wow,  I'm impressed with this lawn mower.  Took me 15 min to unbox it and assemble it.  While the 5 A battery charged  I put in a 2A from my blower.  Plenty of power and the small battery was able to last long enough to cut my small yard.  No complaints.  Love this mower.
reviews.author: wayne

reviews.title: "Grandma's favorite mower"
reviews.text: Bought this for my 77-year old mother-in-law because she couldn't start the gas mower.  Now she loves mowing the yard and won't let us do it for her.  So easy to start, and it has plenty of power for her medium sized yard.  Easily can finish the entire yard on one battery charge.  Great purchase!
reviews.author: BruceG

reviews.title: "Ok alt 40 volt cordless lawn mower."
reviews.text: Well built and sturdy.  Have used it twice so far with excellent results.  Mowed about 1/2 acre and still had 2 lights left out of 4 on battery.  Total time to cut grass was about 40 minutes.  It is not self propelled so a flat lawn would be better. I am 70 years old and can push it easily.
reviews.author: Tom

reviews.title: "Awesome!"
reviews.text: Was a little skeptical of trying this lawnmower since I have always used a gas lawn mower. It was very simple to put together no tools needed at all. Charged the battery took about 1hr 30 min to charge. Started to cut my grass, and lawn mower is very quiet, easy to push. Would recommend!
reviews.author: Juan

reviews.title: "Great mower, easy to adjust."
reviews.text: This mower is light, easy to use and adjust. No assent required was nice. It able to hang on the wall if you want it out of the way. The battery charges fast and lasts about 1/2 an hour. I would grab an extra battery if you have a larger yard. I'm glad I made the switch from gas!
reviews.author: Paul

reviews.text: Its awesome. Love it, it easy to push. I mow the yard faster.
reviews.author: Marianne

reviews.title: "Great product for price"
reviews.text: Disappointed because it came damaged, scuffs and such. Also it takes 2-3 hours for the battery to charge and it only lasts 29-33 minutes per charge. It does not mow 1/3 in one charge. So be ware of that when purchasing. We will be getting a 2nd battery to increaseFunctionality.
reviews.author: Liz

reviews.title: "Ready to Mow"
reviews.text: Mower was lightweight without feeling like it would flip over every turn. Battery came partially charged—enough to get 80% of my lawn done—and topped off enough in 15 minutes to finish the last 20%!Folds easily and stores upright to not take up a ton of space. Great value!
reviews.author: dannyomo

reviews.title: "Great mower"
reviews.text: I have about 400 ft.  Of grass in my backyard. It is lush Bluegrass and rye Mix. This mower does a great job of cutting it. Even when the grass was 4 inches long the engine revved up a little higher to take care of the thick grass. A good value mower that's easy to handle.
reviews.author: Dicko6

reviews.title: "It's ELECTRIC!"
reviews.text: Love it!  Avoids extra trips to the gas station because you're out of gas plus you avoid having toxic liquids at home (gasoline/oil) that can be harmful and dangerous if not kept in a safe place.  Mows the lawn perfectly.  It's easy to push and easy to charge and go.
reviews.author: MrsPosh

reviews.title: "Love this thing!"
reviews.text: Going from a Corded to a cordless lawnmower is one of the greatest decisions I've made in my life; far in my list of Top 10 decisions which includes getting married, having a baby and saying yes to a new job offer. I also love all Kobalt products. Very reliable.
reviews.author: Matt

reviews.title: "Get a different electric mower"
reviews.text: If you keep your lawn short and mow every day then this is the mower for you. If you have a lawn that is more than 3in tall look elsewhere because this thing bogs down like crazy.  This is easily the worst electric mower I've ever used and will be returning it.
reviews.author: Topshot9000

reviews.title: "works great"
reviews.text: Bought this back in March and it has worked every bit as well as a gas mower. I can even store it standing up against the wall to keep it out if the way. We'll see how long it will last over the next few years but they do have a warranty so im not too worried.
reviews.author: RN

reviews.title: "Great Deal - Great Mower"
reviews.text: Seriously tired of gasoline mowers, noise, fumes, maintenance, and being difficult on occasion.  New mower is quiet, efficient, and performance was excellent on its initial outing.  Lowe's price was the deal hanger that made this purchase  an easy decision.
reviews.author: Phil

reviews.title: "New lawn mower"
reviews.text: I love this lawn mower, and I give it 5 stars.  This one is not self propelled, but I did not want a self propelled, as I like the workout, mowing the lawn, as does my daughter also.  It cuts the grass beautifully.  I have no complaints about this mower.
reviews.author: JD

reviews.title: "Very little suction"
reviews.text: I was excited to get the lawnmower, but first time out it couldn't pick up anything heavier than a blade of grass - no leaves, no small twigs, etc. . . $300 wasted!
reviews.author: DD

reviews.title: "No more arm jerking or smelly gas!"
reviews.text: I bought my Kobalt couple of months ago and I am glad I did. I'm a 67 year old woman and I'm here to tell you, it's perfect for my small yard. It even handled the really high grass when we had too much rain to get out. Great choice.
reviews.author: Susan

reviews.title: "Love it love it love it"
reviews.text: I am a 69 year old female using this mower!  Ease of use, battery life makes this the best purchase I've made in a while.  A real money saver! (was paying $40-$45 for lawn care visits) I can't image anyone not liking this mower!
reviews.author: Patricia

reviews.title: "Not Recommend"
reviews.text: When mowing the lawn keep cutting off. Battery don't last long.
reviews.author: Milton

reviews.title: "Great lawn mower"
reviews.text: We've had a plug in electric mower and gas push mower thatneeds constant maintainance. This battery powered Kobalt is the answer.  It's great for a small yard and leaves no gas can smell in our shed. We love this mower!
reviews.author: G

reviews.title: "quick, quiet and easy to use"
reviews.text: Battery charges quick, its not too heavy for a push mower, reasonably priced and came with the battery! Some mowers made you buy the $300 battery separately! I don't have a big yard so this voltage works for me!
reviews.author: kate

reviews.title: "Disappointed"
reviews.text: Love the mower, hate the battery life. Even the 4 amp battery which isn't available anymore, lasts very long. Our lawn is less than 25% of a 80x130 lot and both batteries can't do half of it at a time.
reviews.author: Kenk

reviews.title: "Very Handy Mower"
reviews.text: I bought this mower on sale. very pleased with it's performance.   Cuts as good as my gas mower and the battery Lasts abt as long as a tank of gas.  Very light weight and easy to push, even up hill.
reviews.author: Bear

reviews.title: "Great mower for great price"
reviews.text: I have used this twice so far and it is a great mower.  Just as advertised. Took about 2 hours to charge battery and it lasts about 45 minutes which is enough time to get my entire yard mowed.
reviews.author: Sandy

reviews.title: "Excellent product with a great warranty"

reviews.title: "Works great overall!"
reviews.text: I bought this because I'm terrible about doing maintenance on gas mowers. It was easy to set up, just pop the handle up, a couple bolts and you're done. I appreciate the adjustable handle, I'm 6'3” and I don't have to bend down at all, a welcome change from my last mower. The 1 handle adjustable mower height lever is easy to use, and it has plenty of positions. The battery life varies, depending on how thick/tall the grass is. When it hasn't been too long and the grass is dry, it gets through my yard in one charge with no problem (about 30' x 70'). If I let it go too long, or the grass is damp, it takes 2 charges to get through. If you're like me, spend the extra $30 and get the exact same mower that includes the additional battery. The only quibbles I have is if the grass gets too long, I have to take narrow passes to avoid bogging it down and stopping the mower, or set it high to start and make 2 passes. My other issue is that the grass catcher doesn't do all that well. The grass sits low in the bag and ends up blocking the outlet, and most of the bag stays empty, so I just leave it on the mulch setting and it does fine.

reviews.title: "Things You Should Know"
reviews.text: I still love this mower but you need to be willing to make some trade-offs before you switch from gas.  I have a smallish 4200 square foot lawn. With this mower I need to mow more often, it doesn't mulch as well, and I need to keep the blades sharp all the time. Like I said, I still prefer this to the smell and noise of gas as well as keeping gasoline around the house. It's also much lighter and easier to steer. It just doesn't have the brute force of a gas mower.Mulching only works when you mow often. If you let the grass get too long it leaves clumps behind it unless you bag. It does kick up speed to deal with heavy spots but if it does that often it really wears down the batteries fast. The ideal height to mow again is such that it seldom kicks up to high power. If I let the grass get long I need to kick up the blade height and bag.  I bought a second set of blades and change/sharpen them every three or four times.I still prefer this to gas but this season with all the rain the grass has been growing like mad.  I've occasionally mowed twice a week to keep up. When I owned a larger home and big lawn I would not be able to use this.
